 Document(page_content='of\tour\thand\timproving.\tAs\tsuch,\tour\tplan\there\tis\tto\tbet\tsmall\tto\tmaintain\tstack\tmaneuverability\tfor\nreasons\tdiscussed\tpreviously.\tWe\tbet\taround\t1/3-pot,\t1.8BB\tinto\tthe\t5.4BB\tpot.\tVillain\tcalls.\tThe\tturn\tis\nthe\t(J\n-7\n-6\n)-Q\n\tand\the\tchecks\tagain.\tThis\tis\ta\tgood\tcard\tfor\tour\trange.\tIn\taddition\tto\tour\tflop\tvalue\nhands,\twe\tconceivably\thave\ta\tnumber\tof\tQ-10,\tQ-9\tand\tQ-8\thands\twith\twhich\twe\twould\tcontinuation\nbet.\tIt\talso\tallows\tus\tto\tapply\tpressure\tto\tany\tone\tpair\thands\tthat\tour\topponent\tmost\tlikely\tflopped.\tThe\npot\tis\tnow\t9BB\t–\thow\tmuch\tshould\twe\tbet?\tWe\thave\t14.2BB\tleft\tin\tour\tstack\tand\twe\twant\tto\tensure\twe\nhave\tenough\tchips\tto\tmake\ta\tsizable\triver\tshove.\tWe\tbet\taround\t35%-40%\tof\tthe\tpot\t–\t3.5BB.\tVillain\ncalls.\tAt\tthis\tpoint,\tVillain’s\trange\tof\thands\tis\tmostly\tone\tpair\thands\tsuch\tas\tJ-x,\t8-7,\t9-7,\tK-7,\tor\tA-7.\nHe\tstill\thas\ta\tfew\ttwo\tpair\thands\tbut\tthere\taren’t\tmany\tcombinations\tof\tthose,\tespecially\tas\tthe\tweaker\ntwo\tpairs\twould\thave\tlikely\tcheck-raised\tby\tthis\tpoint.\tHe\tcould\talso\thave\ta\tfew\tcombinations\tof\tA-10\nthat\the\tjust\tcalled\tpreflop,\tcalled\tpostflop\tbecause\tour\tbet\twas\tsmall,\tand\thas\tnow\tturned\tsome\tmore\nequity.\nThe\triver\tis\tthe\t(J\n-7\n-6\n-Q\n)-5\n.\tVillain\tchecks.\tDo\twe\tgo\tall-in?\tThe\tpot\tis\t16BB\tand\twe\thave\n10.7BB\tleft\tin\tour\tstack,\twhich\tis\tbig\tenough\tto\tmake\tany\treasonable,\tthinking\topponent\tfold\tone\tpair.\nHis\trange\thas\tvery\tfew\tstraights\tand\tflushes;\t9-8\twould\thave\tlikely\tcheck-raised\tthe\tflop\tor\tturn,\tand\tour\n9\n\tblocks\ta\tnumber\tof\tflush\tcombinations\the\tcould\thave.\tMeanwhile,\tour\trange\tcan\tstill\thave\trivered\nstraights\tand\tflushes,\tsome\ttwo\tpairs,\ttop\tpair\tand\tnot\tthat\tmany\tbluffs.\tTherefore,\tthis\tis\ta\tgood\tspot\tto\ngo\tall-in\tand\twe\twill\tlikely\twin\ta\thealthy\tpot.\nPhil\nIf\tI’m\tplaying\tsuper\ttight\tpoker\t(like\tI\tusually\tdo),\tthen\tI\twould\teither\tfold\tthe\thand\tpreflop,\tor\topen\tfor\n3BB\t(300).\tI\twould\tmake\tmy\tdecision\tas\tto\twhether\tor\tnot\tI\traise\tor\tfold\tbased\ton\thow\toften\tI\thave\nopened\tpots\tin\tthe\tlast\t30\tminutes\t(do\tmy\topponents\tthink\tI’m\tplaying\tsuper\ttight?).\tIf\tI\thave\tindeed\nfolded\ta\thigh\tpercentage\tof\thands\tover\tthe\tlast\t30\tminutes,\tthen\tI\twould\traise\tit\tto\t300.\tMy\tthinking\there\nis\tthat\tI\twant\tto\tgive\tmy\tsuper\ttight\timage\ta\tchance\tto\twin\tsome\tmuch\tneeded\tchips\trisk\tfree.\tAlso,\nopening\tfor\t3BB\tgives\tme\ta\tbetter\tchance\tto\tinduce\tboth\tblinds\tto\tfold\tpreflop\tcompared\tto\topening\tfor\n2BB.\nAssuming\tthat\tI\tdid\topen\tfor\t3BB,\tand\tthat\tI\twas\tcalled\tpreflop,\tthen\tI\tthink\tthat\tputting\ta\tbet\tin\ton\tthe\nflop\tafter\tmy\topponent\tchecks\tis\treasonable.\tI\talso\tthink\tthat\tchecking\tbehind\ton\tthe\tflop\tis\ta\treasonable,\nbut\tslightly\tweaker,\tplay.\tI\tprefer\ta\tflop\tbet\tof\tabout\t50%\tof\tthe\tpot\tsize\tas\tit\tgives\tme\t(and\tmy\ttight\nimage!)\tanother\tchance\tto\twin\tthe\tpot.\nAssuming\tthat\tmy\t300\tbet\tis\tcalled\ton\tthe\tflop,\tI\twould\tcheck\ton\tthe\tturn\tand\ttake\ta\tfree\tcard.\tI\tam\nreasoning\tthat\tI\tonly\thave\t1,200\tleft\t(after\tbetting\t300\tand\t300),\tand\tthere\tis\t1,200\tin\tthe\tpot.\tThus\tmy\nability\tto\tbluff\tthe\tnext\ttwo\tstreets\tis\tdiminished.\tPlus,\tI\tthink\tthat\tmost\tonline\tplayers\twill\tcall\ta\t1,200\nall-in\tbet\tinto\ta\t1,200\tpot\tif\tthey\thave\ta\tmarginal\thand,\tsuch\tas\ta\tpair\tof\tsevens,\tin\tthis\tspot.\tI\tdon’t\tmind\ngiving\tup\there\tafter\trunning\tinto\tresistance\tboth\tpreflop\tand\ton\tthe\tflop.\tOf\tcourse,\tI\tcan\talways\thit\tmy\nstraight\twith\ta\tqueen\tor\tan\teight,\tor\tI\tcould\thit\ta\tpair\tof\ttens\tor\tnines.\tIn\tthe\tcase\tof\thitting\ta\tpair\to ain,\tI\twanted\tto\tgive\tmyself\tthe\nbest-possible\tchance\tto\tdouble\tup,\tand\tA-4\tisn’t\tit!\tNext\thand\twhile\tin\tthe\tsmall\tblind,\tKenny\t“Skyhawk”\nFlaton\t–\ta\tgreat\tplayer,\tbut\tan\teven\tgreater\tguy\t–\traised\ttwo\toff\tof\tthe\tbutton\twith\t7-7,\tand\tI\tmoved\tall-in\nfor\t800\ttotal\twith\tA\n-Q\n.\tWhen\ta\tqueen\thit\tthe\tboard,\tI\twon\tthe\t1,800\tpot.\nNext\thand,\ton\tthe\tbutton\tI\tpicked\tup\tQ-Q,\tand\traised\tone\tplayer\twho\thad\tlimped\tin.\tEveryone\tfolded,\nand\tnow\tI\thad\t2,300.\tThe\tvery\tnext\thand\tI\tpicked\tup\tJ-J,\tand\tI\tmoved\tall-in\twhen\tsomeone\telse\topened\nwith\tA-Q.\tThe\tA-Q\tcalled\tme,\tand\tmy\tJ-J\twon\tthe\t4,900\tpot.\tThree\thands\tlater,\tI\twas\tUTG\tagain,\tthis\ntime\twith\tA-A.\tI\topened\tfor\t600,\tand\tSkyhawk\traised\tme\t2,400\tmore\tfrom\tthe\tsmall\tblind.\tI\tmoved\tall-\nin,\tand\tSkyhawk\tquickly\tcalled\tand\tflipped\tup\tQ-Q.\tMy\tA-A\theld\tup,\tand\tnow\tI\thad\texactly\t10,000!\nI\thad\tstarted\tthe\tround\twith\t300,\tand\tended\tit\twith\t10,000!\tWow!\t“OK,”\tI\tthought,\t“I\tmust\tnot\tlose\ta\nbig\tpot,\tas\toften\ttimes\tI\tdo\twhen\tI\tmake\ta\tbig\tcomeback\tlike\tthis.”\tBut\tno,\tI\tcouldn’t\thelp\twhat\thappened\nnext;\talthough\tI\tshould\thave\tbeen\table\tto!\tI\traised\tit\tup\twith\t9-9,\tand\twas\tcalled\tby\tA-A\t(smooth\tcalling\nwith\tA-A\tcan\tbe\tvery\tdangerous!).\tAfter\ta\tflop\tof\t8-6-4,\tI\tbet\tout\tand\twas\traised.\tI\tdidn’t\tknow\tmy\nopponent\tfrom\tAdam\tand\tI\tdecided\tthat\the\tprobably\thad\tA-8,\tand\tI\tmoved\thim\tall-in.\tKnowing\tyour\nopponent\tcan\tmake\tall\tof\tthe\tdifference\tin\tthe\tworld\tin\ta\tsituation\tlike\tthis.\tAfter\tplaying\twith\thim\tthe\trest\nof\tthe\tday,\tI\twill\tfold\tin\tthe\tsame\tsituation\tnext\ttime.\tBut\talas,\the\tcalled,\tand\this\thand\theld\tup,\tand\tnow\tI\nwas\tdown\tto\tabout\t3,000\tagain.\nAfter\tbeing\tdown\tto\t300,\ta\tstack\tof\t3,000\tstill\tseemed\tlike\ta\tlot\tof\tchips\tto\tme,\tand\tI\tfelt\tconfident\tthat\nI\twould\trun\tit\tup\tagain.\tI\tfought\tand\tfought,\tand\tby\tthe\ttime\twe\treached\tthe\tfinal\ttable,\tI\thad\tthe\tchip\tlead\nwith\tover\t60,000.\nExample\t(5BB)\nPhil\nI\twas\tplaying\tin\ta\tWSOP\tAPAC\tevent\tin\tMelbourne\twhen\tthis\thand\tcame\tup\tearly\ton\tDay\t1.\tThere\twere\neight\tplayers\tat\tmy\ttable,\tthe\tblinds\twere\t150/300-25.\tThe\tfirst\ttwo\tplayers\tfolded,\tand\tthe\tthird\tplayer\nopened\tfor\t600.\tI\thad\tA-9\toffsuit.\tWith\tmy\ttiny\t5BB\t(1,500)\tchip\tstack,\tI\twasn’t\tsure\twhat\tthe\tmath', chool\tstyle\tof\tpoker.', wo\tplayers\twith\tmore\tthan\tyou)\tor\tin\tfairly\tbad\tshape\t(when\tthe\ntwo\tplayers\twho\thave\tmore\tthan\tyou\thave\tsignificantly\tmore\tthan\tyou).\tYour\tstack\tsize\tin\trelation\tto\tboth\nthe\tlarge\tstacks\tand\tthe\tshort\tstacks\tshould\tdrastically\taffect\tyour\tdefault\tstrategy.\nIn\tgeneral,\twhen\tyou\thave\tcomfortably\tmore\tchips\tthan\tthe\tshortest\tstacks,\tyou\tare\tin\tdecent\tshape.\nWhen\tyou\thave\tthis\tspecific\tstack\tsize,\tif\tyou\twin\tan\tall-in\tversus\ta\tlarge\tstack,\tyou\twill\teither\tbe\tin\ta\nposition\tto\tcripple\tthem\tor\tyou\twon’t.\tWhen\tyou\tcan\tcripple\tthe\tlarge\tstacks,\tit\tis\tusually\ta\tdecent\tidea\tto\napply\tpressure\ton\tthem\tto\tsee\tif\tthey\twill\tplay\tstraightforwardly\tversus\tyou.', ook\tto\tcall\twith\tmost\tof\tyour\thands\tthat\thave\texcellent\npostflop\tpotential,\tassuming\tyou\tdo\tnot\texpect\tto\tget\tre-raised\ttoo\toften\tby\tthe\tplayers\tyet\tto\tact.\tIf\tyou\nexpect\tthe\tplayers\tyet\tto\tact\tto\tfrequently\tre-raise\tif\tyou\tcall,\tyou\tshould\ttend\tto\tfold\tmost\tof\tyour\nspeculative\thands.\tIf\tyour\topponents\tare\tonly\tplaying\tpremium\thands,\tit\tis\trarely\ta\tleak\tto\tsimply\tstay\tout\nof\ttheir\tway\tbecause\tthey\twill\tnot\tsteal\tthe\tblinds\toften\tenough\tfor\tthem\tto\tmake\ta\tprofit\tin\tthe\tlong\trun.\nWhen\tone\tspecific\tplayer\tat\tthe\ttable\tis\toverly\tactive,\tyou\tshould\tfigure\tout\tif\the\tis\tcapable\tof\tfolding', stakes\ttournaments\tcan\tbe\nhuge.\tFor\texample,\twhen\tplaying\tin\ta\tlocal\t$100\ttournament,\tperhaps\t1st\tplace\tis\t$1,000\tand\t2nd\tplace\tis\n$600.\tYou\tare\tonly\tplaying\tfor\t$400.\tIn\ta\thigh\tstakes\ttournament,\tthe\tdifference\tcan\tbe\tin\tthe\t$100,000\nrange\tor\tmore.\tIt\tis\tcertainly\tworth\tgambling\ta\tbit\twhen\tyou\tare\tplaying\tthe\tsmall\tstakes\tgames\tin\torder\tto\nget\texperience\tso\tyou\tare\tnot\tcompletely\toutmatched\twhen\tyou\tare\tfortunate\tenough\tto\tget\tto\tplay\tfor\tlife-\nchanging\tmoney.\nThe\tmain\ttime\tyou\tshould\tchop\tis\twhen\tthe\tdifference\tbetween\tthe\tcurrent\tpayout\tand\t1st\tplace\tis', en\tyou\thave\ta\tlarge\tstack,\tyou\nshould\toften\tsuggest\tthat\tyou\tuse\tthis\tmethod\tto\tchop\tthe\tpayouts.\tThat\tbeing\tsaid,\tmost\tplayers\tare\ncatching\tonto\tthe\tfact\tthat\tthis\tmethod\tis\tnot\tthe\t“correct”\tway\tto\tsplit\tthe\tpot.\nWhen\tyou\thave\ta\tshort\tstack,\tyou\tshould\ttry\tto\toffer\ta\tdeal\treferred\tto\tas\ta\t“Save”.\tA\tSave\tis\twhen\tthe\nplayers\tall\ttake\tan\tequal\tamount\tof\tmoney\toff\tthe\ttable\tand\tplay\tfor\tthe\trest.\tFor\texample,\tsuppose\tyou\nare\theads-up\twith\t5,000\tchips\tcompared\tto\tyour\topponent’s\t10,000\tchips.\tFirst\tplace\tis\t$750,000\tand\n2nd\tplace\tis\t$400,000.\tWhen\tyou\tare\tplaying\theads-up,\tICM\tno\tlonger\tapplies\tbecause\tyou\tare\neffectively\tplaying\ta\theads-up\tmatch\tfor\tthe\tdifference\tbetween\t1st\tand\t2nd\tplace\tmoney.\nThis\tmeans\tthat\tyou\tare\tplaying\tfor\t$350,000.\tSince\tyou\thave\t33%\tof\tthe\tchips\tin\tplay,\tyou\town\t33%\nof\t$350,000,\twhich\tis\t$116,655\ton\ttop\tof\tthe\t$400,000\tyou\thave\talready\tlocked\tup,\tgiving\tyou\t$516,665\nin\tequity.\tYour\topponent\towns\t$233,345\tplus\tthe\t$400,000\the\thas\tlocked\tup,\tgiving\thim\t$633,345\tin\nequity.\nIf\tyou\tboth\tagree\tto\tmake\ta\tSave\tfor\t$500,000,\tyou\teach\ttake\tthat\tamount\tfrom\tthe\tprize\tpool\tand\tare\nnow\tplaying\tfor\t$150,000.\tYou\town\t33%\tof\t$150,000,\twhich\tis\t$50,000.\tNotice\tthat\tby\tmaking\tthis\nSave,\tyou\tnow\town\t$50,000\tplus\tthe\t$500,000\tyou\tlocked\tup,\tmeaning\tyou\town\t$550,000\tin\tequity\tand\nyour\topponent\towns\t$600,000\tin\tequity.\tIf\tyou\tand\tyour\topponent\tagree\tto\tthis\tSave,\tyou\timmediately\nprofit\t$33,345\tin\tequity.\nThe\tinteresting\tthing\tto\tnote\tabout\tSaves\tis\tthat\tmost\tamateur\tplayers\tthink\tthey\tare\ta\tgreat\tidea,\nregardless\tof\ttheir\tstack\tsize.\tThey\tseem\tto\tlove\tlocking\tin\ta\tsolid\twin\tand\tare\tnot\taware\tthat\twhen\tyou\nadjust\tthe\tpayouts,\tyou\talter\teach\tplayer’s\tequity.\nA ime\tyou\tdo\tnot\thave\ta\tstrong\thand.\nLearning\tto\tplay\theads-up\tis\ta\tlifelong\tendeavor.\tI\tstrongly\tsuggest\tthat\tyou\tspend\tsome\ttime\tlearning\nto\tplay\tit\tbefore\tyour\tnext\tpoker\ttournament.\tHeads-up\tis\teasy\tto\tget\texperience\tat\tbecause\tall\tyou\tneed\tis\none\tother\tplayer,\tsome\tchips,\tand\ta\tdeck\tof\tcards.\tIdeally,\tyou\tcan\tfind\teither\ta\tpoker\tfriend\tor\ta\tfamily\nmember\twho\twill\tpractice\twith\tyou\ton\ta\tregular\tbasis.\tIf\tyou\tmake\ta\tpoint\tto\tstudy\tthe\tgame,\twhen\tyou\nfind\tyourself\tplaying\tfor\tthe\tbig\tbucks,\tyou\twill\tbe\twell\tprepared,\tallowing\tyou\tto\tat\tleast\thold\tyour\town\nand\tperhaps\tcrush\tyour\topponent.', \tsplits\tthe\trange\twith\twhich\the\tarrives\tthere.\tHe\nchooses\tan\taction\tto\ttake\tfor\teach\tcomponent\tof\this\trange.\tIf\twe\tknow\ta\tplayer’s\trange\tfor\ttaking\teach\naction,\twe\tcan\toften\tmore\tor\tless\twork\tout\this\tstrategy.\tFor\texample,\tif\twe\tknow\the\tarrives\tat\ta\tpoint\nwith\t20%\n1\n\tof\ta\thand,\tand\this\trange\tfor\ttaking\tone\taction\tincludes\t15%\tof\tthe\thand\tand\tthe\tother\tincludes\n5%,\tthen\twe\tcan\treason\tthat\tat\tthat\tpoint,\this\tstrategy\tinvolves\ttaking\tthe\tfirst\taction\t3/4\tof\tthe\ttime\tand\nthe\tsecond\t1/4\tof\tthe\ttime.\tHowever,\tif\ta\tplayer\tarrives\tat\ta\tpoint\twith\t0%\tof\ta\thand\t(because\this\tstrategy\nis\tsuch\tthat\the\tnever\tgets\tto\tthis\tspot\twith\tthis\thand),\tthen\tall\tof\this\tsubsequent\taction\tranges\tmust\talso\ncontain\t0%\tof\tthe\thand.\tHis\tstrategy,\tby\tdefinition,\tmust\tdictate\this\tplay\there,\tbut\twe\tcan’t\tuse\this\tranges\nto\tfigure\tout\this\tfrequencies.\nSo,\tif\twe\tknow\ta\tstrategy,\twe\tcan\tfind\tthe\tranges.\tFurthermore\tif\twe\tknow\tranges,\twe\tcan\twork\tout\nparts\tof\tthe\tstrategy\t–\tthose\tthat\twe\tmight\tconsider\tmost\timportant\t–\tthe\tparts\tthat\tdescribe\tplay\tin\tspots\nthe\tplayers\tcan\tactually\tget\tto\twhen\tthey\tplay\ttheir\tstrategies.\tFor\tpractical\tpurposes,\twhen\twe\tdescribe\nplayers’\tstrategies,\twe’ll\tusually\ttalk\tabout\ttheir\tranges,\tbut\tto\tbe\tclear,\tthey’re\tnot\texactly\tthe\tsame\tthing.\nGreat,\tnow\twe’re\tready\tto\trevisit\tGTO\tin\tfull\tforce.\tSo\tagain,\ta\tset\tof\tstrategies\tis\tGTO\tif\tno\tplayer\ncan\tunilaterally\tdeviate\tand\tincrease\this\taverage\tprofit.\tAn\tequivalent\tway\tto\tput\tthis\tis\tto\tsay\tthat\tevery\nplayer\tis\tplaying\tmaximally\texploitably\t(i.e.\tas\tprofitably\tas\tpossible),\tgiven\this\topponents’\tstrategies.\nSo,\tif\tall\tplayers\tbut\tone\tin\ta\tgame\tare\tplaying\tstrategies\tfrom\ta\tGTO\tset,\tthen\tthe\tlast\tplayer\tcan\tdo\tno\nbetter\tthan\tto\talso\tplay\this\tstrategy\tfrom\tthe\tset.\nA\tset\tof\tGTO\tstrategies\tis\talso\tcalled\tan\tequilibrium\tor\ta\tNash\tequilibrium,\tand\tif\tall\tplayers\tare\nplaying\ttheir\tstrategy\tfrom\tan\tequilibrium,\twe\tsay\twe’re\tat\tequilibrium.\nLet’s\ttake\ta\tlook\tat\tone\tconsequence\tof\tthese\tdefinitions\tthat\tmany\tplayers\tfind\tcounterintuitive.\tThis\nisn’t\tsuper\timportant\tin\tand\tof\titself,\tbut\tit’ll\thelp\tus\tto\tbecome\tmore\tfamiliar\twith\tthe\tconcepts.\nA\tGTO\tstrategy\tcan\tinvolve\tfolding\tthe\tnuts,\teven\ton\tthe\triver.\nSuppose\twe’re\tat\tequilibrium.\tNo\tplayer\thas\tany\tincentive\tto\tchange\this\tstrategy.\tImagine\ttaking', o.\tThe\tdefinition\tof\nequilibrium\ttells\tus\tonly\tthat\tif\tall\tplayers\texcept\tone\tplay\tstrategies\tfrom\ta\tGTO\tset,\tthen\tthe\tlast\tone\nwould\tdo\tbest\tto\tplay\this\tstrategy\tfrom\tthat\tset\tas\twell.\tSo,\tif\ttwo\tplayers\there\tswitch,\tthen\tthe\tthird\nshould\tas\twell.\tHowever,\twhen\tHero\tunilaterally\tswitches\tfrom\t\nA\n\tto\t\nB\n,\the\tmay\thave\tsimply\tlowered\this\nprofit\tand\tincreased\tthat\tof\tboth\tof\this\topponents!\nThe\tlesson\there?\tIn\ta\t3-player\t(or\tmore)\tzero\tsum\tgame,\tthere’s\tno\treason\tto\tthink\tthat\tdistinct\tGTO\nsets\tlead\tto\tthe\tsame\texpected\tprofit\tfor\teach\tplayer.\tThus,\tin\tgame,\tif\tone\tGTO\tset\tis\tbeing\tplayed\twhen', \tprofitably\tas',  Document(page_content='exploitatively,\tsimultaneously,\twith\teach\tof\tthe\tthree\ttypes\tof\thands\tin\tthis\tgame:\nWith\tHero’s\tnuts,\tEV(checking)\t=\t200BB\tand\tEV(betting)\t=\n(1/2)\tx\t(200BB)\t+\t(1/2)\tx\t(300BB)\t=\t250BB,\nso\talways\tbetting\tis\tindeed\tbest.\nWith\tHero’s\tbluffs,\tEV(checking)\t=\t100BB\tand\tEV(betting)\t=\n(1/2)\tx\t(0BB)\t+\t(1/2)\tx\t(200BB)\t=\t100BB.\nBoth\tactions\there\thave\tthe\tsame\tEV!\tThus,\teither\tchoice\tis\tmaximally\texploitative.\tThis\tis\tgood,\tsince\nwe’ve\tclaimed\tthat\tHero\tis\tplaying\tmaximally\texploitatively\twhile\tusing\tboth\tactions\tsome\tof\tthe\ttime.\nAs\tfor\tVillain’s\tbluffcatchers,\tonce\tthey\tface\ta\tbet:\nTheir\tEV(folding)\tis\t100BB,\nand\ttheir\tEV(calling)\tis\t(2/3)\tx\t(0)\t+\t(1/3)\tx\t(300)\t=\t100BB.\nAgain,\tthese\tare\tequal,\tso\tVillain\tcan\tmake\teither\tchoice\tand\tstill\tbe\tmaximally\texploiting\tHero.\nNotice,\tby\tthe\tway,\tthat\tVillain’s\tEV\tfrom\tthe\tbeginning\tof\triver\tplay\tis\tsomewhat\thigher\tthan\t100BB,\tsince\the\tdoesn’t\talways\nface\ta\tbet.\tWhat\tis\tVillain’s\tEV\tat\tthe\tbeginning\tof\triver\tplay\twhen\tHero\tplays\this\tGTO\tstrategy,\tassuming\tVillain\tplans\tto\tcall\nwhen\the\tfaces\ta\tbet?\tWhat\tif\tVillain\tplans\tto\tfold\tto\tany\tbet?\n6\nNow,\twe’ve\tsaid\tthat\tin\ta\tcouple\tof\tspots,\tthe\tplayers\tcan\tchoose\tmultiple\tactions\tand\tstill\tbe\tplaying\nmaximally\texploitatively.\tHowever,\tthat\tdoesn’t\tmean\tthey’d\tstill\tbe\tat\tequilibrium\tif\tthey\tchose\tdifferent\nfrequencies\tthere.\tIn\tfact,\twe\tsaw\tin\tthe\tEV\tcalculations\tthat\tthe\tGTO\tfrequencies\tfor\tone\tplayer\twere\nresponsible\tfor\tperfectly\tbalancing\tthe\tother\tplayer’s\tEVs.\tFor\texample,\tif\tHero\tdecided\tto\tbluff\tjust\nslightly\tmore\toften\tthen,\tall\tof\ta\tsudden,\tVillain\twould\tstrictly\tprefer\tto\tcall\trather\tthan\tto\tfold\twith\tall\tof\nhis\tbluff\tcatchers.\tThis\topportunity\tfor\tVillain\tto\timprove\this\tEV\tby\tchanging\this\tstrategy\tmeans\twe’re\tno\nlonger\tat\tequilibrium.\tAt\tequilibrium,\tHero’s\tbluffing\tfrequency\tis\tchosen\tso\tthat\this\tbetting\trange\tis\nperfectly\tbalanced\tand\tmakes\tVillain\tperfectly\tindifferent\tbetween\tcalling\tand\tfolding.\nThis\tsort\tof\n\tindifference\tbetween\tmultiple\toptions\tactually\tcomes\tup\toften\tin\tGTO\tsolutions\tof\treal\npoker\tgames.\tWhenever\ta\tmixed\tstrategy\tis\tplayed\tat\tequilibrium,\tit\tmust\tbe\tthe\tcase\tthat\tthe\tEVs\tof\nmultiple\toptions\tare\tequal.\tConsidering\tback\tand\tforth\texploitation\tà\tla\tFictitious\tPlay\tcan\tsometimes\nmake\tit\teasy\tto\tsee\twhen\tpure\tstrategies\tjust\tcan’t\tbe\tGTO.\tFor\texample,\tsuppose\twe\tsee\ta\tflop\twith\ta\nflush\tdraw\tpossible\tand\twe’re\tout\tof\tposition\tfacing\ta\tcontinuation\tbet.\tSuppose\twe\talways\tcheck-raise\nwith\tall\tof\tour\tflush\tdraws,\tand\tVillain\tknows\tit.\tThen\tit’s\treasonable\tto\tthink\tthat\tafter\twe\traise\tand\tthe\nflush\tcomes,\tVillain\twon’t\tput\ttoo\tmuch\tmoney\tin\tthe\tpot,\twhereas\the\twill\tplay\tmuch\tlooser\tthan\the\tmight\notherwise\twhen\twe\tflat\tcall\tthe\tflop\tand\tthe\tflush\tcomes,\tsince\the\tknows\twe\tcan’t\thave\tit.\tIn\tthat\tcase,\tit\nwill\tactually\tbecome\tquite\tprofitable\tfor\tus\tto\tstart\tcheck-calling\tthe\tflop\twith\tthe\tdraw\tin\torder\tto\tshow\nup\twith\ta\tflush\twhen\tit\tcomes.\tSimilarly,\tif\twe\tonly\tcheck-call\twith\tflush\tdraws,\tthen\tVillain’s\tmaximally\nexploitative\tresponse\tfigures\tto\tmotivate\tus\tto\tstart\tcheck-raising.\tSince\tneither\talways\tcalling\tnor\nalways\traising\tcan\tbe\tGTO,\twe\tmust\tbe\tdoing\tboth\tsome\tof\tthe\ttime.\tFurthermore,\tfor\tthat\tto\tbe\tthe\tcase,\nVillain\thas\tto\tplay\tin\tprecisely\tthe\tright\tway\tto\tmake\tthe\tEVs\tof\tthe\ttwo\toptions\tequal.\tThis\tis\tan\ninteresting\tfact\tabout\tVillain’s\tstrategy\tthat\twe\tcan\tsometimes\tleverage.\nFor\texample,\tin\tthe\tPvBC\triver\tgame\tabove,\tou likely\tfalling\tbehind.\tThe\tgood\tnews\tis\tthat\tthere\nare\tsome\tsimple\tthings\tthat\tyou\tcan\tdo\tto\timprove\tyour\tmental\tgame.\nI\tbelieve\tthat\tdeveloping\tmental\ttoughness\tis\tthe\tkey\tto\timproving\tone’s\toverall\tmental\tgame.\tPick\tup\nany\tpoker\tmagazine\tor\tbook\tand,\tinevitably,\tthe\tterm\tmental\ttoughness\tis\tmentioned\tas\tan\timportant\tfactor\nfor\tpoker\tsuccess.\tIt’s\tsimple\treally.\tIf\tyou\twant\tto\treach\tyour\tmaximum\tpoker\tperformance,\tyou\tmust\npossess\tmental\ttoughness.\tOn\tthe\tface\tof\tit,\tthis\tsounds\teasy\tenough,\tbut\tthere\tare\tseveral\tfactors\tthat\nmake\tmental\ttoughness\tdifficult\tto\tattain.\tThe\tterm\tis\tthrown\taround\tquite\tliberally,\tbut\twhat\tis\tmental\ntoughness?\nMental\ttoughness\tis\tactually\ta\tconstellation\tof\tseveral\tpsychological\ttraits\tand\tattributes.\tRecent\nresearch\tindicates\tthat\tmental\ttoughness\thas\ta\tstrong\tgenetic\tcomponent\t(Horsburgh\tet\tal.,\t2009)\tand\tthat',  Document(page_content='mentally\ttough\tpeople\tare\table\tto\tmaintain\ttheir\ttoughness\tacross\ta\trange\tof\tsituations\t(personal\tand\nprofessional).\tEven\tso,\tresearch\talso\tsuggests\tthat\tmental\tskills\ttraining\tprograms\thave\ta\trole\tto\tplay\tin\nthe\tdevelopment\tof\tmental\ttoughness.\tUnfortunately,\tnot\tmuch\thas\tbeen\twritten\tabout\thow\tto\tactually\nincrease\tand\tenhance\tthose\ttraits\twithin\toneself.\nThis\tchapter\tis\tdedicated\tto\tgiving\tyou\ta\tsuccinct\texplanation\tof\twhat\tmental\ttoughness\tis,\tand\tI’m\ngoing\tto\tstart\toff\tby\texplaining\twhat\twe\tknow\tabout\tthe\tpsychology\tof\tresilience\tbecause\tresilience\tis\ta\nhallmark\tof\tmental\ttoughness.\tThen,\tI’ll\tprescribe\ta\tseries\tof\tsteps\tthat\tyou\tcan\ttake\tto\tincrease\tyour\nmental\ttoughness.\tThe\tmental\ttools\tthat\tI\toutline\thave\tbeen\tshown\tto\thelp\tpeople\tperform\tmore\nconsistently\tin\tpressure\tfilled\tsituations.\tRemember,\tit\tis\tnot\tenough\tto\tknow\twhat\tskills\tmake\tus\tmentally\ntough;\tyou\thave\tto\tbe\twilling\tto\tdo\tthe\twork\tto\tdevelop\tthem.\tDeveloping\ta\tdaily\troutine\tthat\tyou\tpractice\nwithout\tfail\tis\tthe\tkey\tto\tenhancing\tyour\tmental\ttoughness.\tIf\tyou\tare\twilling\tto\tdo\tthe\twork,\tyou\tcan\nincrease\tyour\tlevel\tof\tmental\ttoughness.\nMental\ttoughness\tdeconstructed\nBecause\tmental\ttoughness\tis\ta\tmulti-dimensional\tconstruct\tthat\thas\tcognitive,\temotional\tand\tbehavioral\ncomponents,\tit\thas\tbeen\tdefined\tin\ta\tmyriad\tof\tways.\tBefore\twe\tconsider\twhat\tpsychological\tresearch\nhas\tto\tsay\ton\tthe\ttopic,\tlet’s\tconsider\thow\tone\tof\tthe\tgreatest\tcoaches\tof\tall\ttime\tviewed\tmental\ntoughness:\nMental\ttoughness\tis\tmany\tthings\tand\trather\tdifficult\tto\texplain.\tIts\tqualities\tare\tsacrifice\tand\tself-denial.\tAlso,\tmost\nimportantly,\tit\tis\tcombined\twith\ta\tperfectly\tdisciplined\twill\tthat\trefuses\tto\tgive\tin.\tIt’s\ta\tstate\tof\tmind;\tyou\tcould\tcall\tit\tcharacter\nin\taction.\t–\tVince\tLombardi\nFor\tan\talternative\tperspective,\tconsider\tthe\tfollowing:\nI’ve\tmissed\tmore\tthan\t9,000\tshots\tin\tmy\tcareer.\tI’ve\tlost\talmost\t300\tgames.\tTwenty-six\ttimes\tI’ve\tbeen\ttrusted\tto\ttake\tthe\tgame\nwinning\tshot\tand\tmissed.\tI\tfailed\tover\tand\tover\tand\tover\tagain\tin\tmy\tlife.\tAnd\tthat\tis\twhy\tI\tsucceed.\t–\tMichael\tJordan\nAs\tyou\twill\tsee,\tboth\tLombardi\tand\tJordan\tknow\ta\tthing\tor\ttwo\tabout\tmental\ttoughness!\tNow\tlet’s\nlook\tat\twhat\tpsychologists\thave\tdiscovered\tabout\tmental\ttoughness.\nIn\tgeneral,\tmental\ttoughness\tis\tthe\tability\tto\twithstand\tadversity\tand\tthe\tresilience\tto\tbounce\tback\tfrom\nfailure\ttime\tafter\ttime.\tIt’s\takin\tto\ta\tpsychological\tmuscle\tthat\tis\tfrequently\tundeveloped\t(or\tunder-\ndeveloped)\tin\tmost\tplayers.\tPsychologists\thave\tlong\tbeen\tinterested\tin\twhat\tmental\ttoughness\tis\tand\twhat\nmakes\tsomeone\tmentally\ttough.\tLet’s\ttake\ta\tlook\tat\tsome\tof\tthe\tresearch.\nThere\tare\tcertain\ttraits\tand\tcharacteristics\tthat\tmentally\ttough\tpeople\tpossess.\tThe\tfollowing\tkey\ncomponents\thave\tconsistently\tbeen\treported\tas\tdescribing\tthe\tmentally\ttough\tcompetitor\t(see\tCrust,\t2007\nand\tGucciardi\tet\tal.,\t2008):\n\tSelf-belief\n\tCommitment\n\tSelf-motivation\n\tThriving\ton\tcompetition\tand\tchallenges\n\tRetaining\tpsychological\tcontrol\tunder\tpressure\n\tResilience\n\tPerseverance\n\tFocus/concentration',  Document(page_content='Over\tthe\tyears,\tseveral\tpsychologists\thave\tattempted\tto\tconsolidate\tthose\ttraits\tinto\ta\tsuccinct\tand\tyet\ndescriptive\tdefinition.\tFor\tinstance,\tGoldberg\t(1998)\tstressed\tthat\ta\tperson\thigh\tin\tmental\ttoughness\tis\none\twho\thas\tthe\tability\tto\thang\tin\tthere\tand\tpersist\tover\tlong\tperiods\tof\ttime,\tcopes\twell\twith\tpressure\nand\tadversity,\tand\thas\tthe\tability\tto\tbounce\tback\tfrom\tfailures.\nJones,\tHanton\tand\tConnaughton\t(2002)\twent\tfurther\tand\tdefined\tmental\ttoughness\tas\tfollows:\nMental\ttoughness\tis\thaving\tthe\tnatural\tor\tdeveloped\tpsychological\tedge\tthat\tenables\tyou\tto\t(a)\tgenerally\tcope\tbetter\tthan\nyour\topponents\twith\tthe\tmany\tdemands\t(competition,\ttraining,\tlifestyle)\tthat\tsport\tplaces\ton\tthe\tperformer,\tand\t(b)\tspecifically,\nbe\tmore\tconsistent\tand\tbetter\tthan\tyour\topponents\tin\tremaining\tdetermined,\tfocused,\tconfident,\tand\tin\tcontrol\tunder\tpressure\n(p.\t209).\nClough,\tEarle,\tand\tSewell\t(2002)\ttook\ta\tslightly\tdifferent\tapproach\twith\ttheir\tstudy\tand\tsubsequent\ndefinition.\tThey\tdrew\tfrom\tthe\tpsychological\tresearch\ton\thardiness\tto\tdevelop\ttheir\ttheory\tof\tmental\ntoughness.\tHardiness\tis\ta\tpersonality\ttrait\tthat\tallows\ta\tperson\tto\tremain\thealthy\twhen\tfaced\twith\thighly\nstressful\tsituations.\tAfter\tusing\tqualitative\tresearch\tmethods\twith\tcoaches,\tathletes,\tand\tsports\npsychologists,\tthey\tdeclared\tthat:\nMentally\ttough\tindividuals\ttend\tto\tbe\tsociable\tand\toutgoing;\tas\tthey\tare\table\tto\tremain\tcalm\tand\trelaxed,\tthey\tare\tcompetitive\nin\tmany\tsituations\tand\thave\tlower\tanxiety\tthan\tothers.\tWith\ta\thigh\tsense\tof\tself-belief\tand\tunshakeable\tfaith\tthat\tthey\tcan\ncontrol\ttheir\town\tdestiny,\tthese\tindividuals\tcan\tremain\trelatively\tunaffected\tby\tcompetition\tor\tadversity\t(p.\t38).\nAnother,\tmore\trecent\tdefinition\tof\tmental\ttoughness\twas\tput\tforth\tby\tGucciardi,\tGordon,\tand\tDimmock\n(2009).\tThey\tdetermined\tthat:\nMental\ttoughness\tis\ta\tcollection\tof\texperientially\tdeveloped\tand\tinherent\tsport-specific\tand\tsports-general\tvalues,\tattitudes,\nemotions,\tand\tcognitions\tthat\tinfluence\tthe\tway\tin\twhich\tan\tindividual\tapproaches,\tresponds\tto,\tand\tappraises\tboth\tnegatively\nand\tpositively\tconstrued\tpressures,\tchallenges,\tand\tadversities\tto\tconsistently\tachieve\this\tor\ther\tgoals\t(p.\t67).\nJim\tLoehr\t(1994),\tone\tof\tthe\tworld’s\tforemost\tsport\tpsychologists,\tdescribed\tmental\ttoughness\tas:\nThe\tability\tto\tconsistently\tperform\ttoward\tthe\tupper\trange\tof\tyour\ttalent\tand\tskill\tregardless\tof\tcompetitive\tcircumstances.\nAs\tyou\tcan\tsee\tfrom\tthe\taforementioned\tdefinitions,\tmental\ttoughness\thas\tmany\tcomponents.\tTo\nbecome\tmentally\ttough,\tyou\tmust\tset\tgoals\tthat\twill\thelp\tyou\tachieve\tsuccess.\tMentally\ttough\tpoker\nplayers\tdo\twhatever\tit\ttakes\tto\treach\ttheir\tgoals\tno\tmatter\tthe\tobstacles\tplaced\tin\ttheir\tpath.\tEven\tif\tyou\nhave\tnot\tbeen\twilling\tto\tdo\twhatever\tit\ttakes\tto\treach\tyour\tpoker\tgoals\tup\tuntil\tnow,\tyou\tcan\tchange\tyour\nattitude,\tbecause\tmental\ttoughness\tskills\tcan\tbe\tlearned.\tThis\tis\tgreat\tnews\tfor\tpoker\tplayers\twho\tare\nwilling\tto\tput\tin\tthe\twork!\nWhile\tit\tis\ttrue\tthat\tno\tone\thas\textensively\tstudied\tmental\ttoughness\tamongst\tpoker\tplayers,\tit\tdoesn’t\nseem\tlike\tmuch\tof\ta\tstretch\tto\tconclude\tthat\tthese\tattributes\twould\tbe\thelpful\tto\tplayers.\tImagine\thow\nyour\tgame\twould\tchange\tif\tyou\thad\tincreased\tlevels\tof\tmotivation\tand\tresilience\t–\tthe\thallmarks\tof\nmental\ttoughness!\tPractically\tspeaking,\ta\tperson\twho\tis\thigh\tin\tmental\ttoughness\tis\table\tto\tregulate\ttheir\nemotions\tas\twell\tas\tmanage\ttheir\tthoughts\tand\tbehaviors,\tespecially\twhen\tthey\tfind\tthemselves\tin\nstressful\tcircumstances.\nElite\tand\tsuper-elite\tpoker\tplayers\tseem\tto\tbe\tparticularly\tinterested\tin\tthese\ttopics,\tand\tit\tis\tnot\nuncommon\tto\thear\tthem\ttalk\tabout\tsuch\ttopics\tin\tinterviews.\tSpecifically,\tboth\tDaniel\tNegreanu\tand\nAntonio\tEsfandiari\thave\tbeen\tvocal\tin\ttheir\tsupport\tof\ttaking\tpsychology\tclasses\tand\tusing\tmental\tgame\ncoaches.\tI\tbelieve\tthat\tplayers\twho\tshow\tconsistent\tresults\tat\thigh\tlevels\tof\tcompetition\tare\tmaking\tuse\nof\tmental\ttoughness\tskills\tand\ttraining\t–\tand\tyou\tshould,\ttoo.\tAfter\treviewing\tthe\tresearch\ton\tresilience,',  Document(page_content='Resilience\nIt’s\thard\tto\tdiscuss\tmental\ttoughness\twithout\ttalking\tabout\tresilience.\tAlmost\teveryone\texperiences\ndifficulties\ton\tthe\tway\tto\tpoker\tsuccess.\tIn\tfact,\tmany\twell\tknown\tplayers\thave\tgone\tbroke\tmultiple\ntimes.\tIf\tyou\tare\ta\ttournament\tplayer\tit\tis\tpossible\tto\tgo\tfor\tyears\twithout\twinning\ta\ttournament.\tIt\twould\nbe\teasy\tto\tgive\tup\tin\tlight\tof\tsuch\tcircumstances,\tbut\tthe\tmentally\ttough\tpoker\tplayer\trefuses\tto\tdo\tthat.\nThe\tword\tresilience\tcomes\tfrom\tthe\tLatin\tverb\t“resilire”\twhich\tmeans\tto\t“leap\tback”\tor\t“rebound.”\nResilience\tis\tyour\tability\tto\tbounce\tback\tfrom\tadversity\tor\tfailure.\tTugade\tand\tFredrickson\t(2004)\tdefine\nresilience\tas\tthe\tcapacity\tto\tmove\ton\tin\ta\tpositive\tway\tfrom\tnegative,\ttraumatic,\tor\tstressful\texperiences.\nResilient\tpeople\tdon’t\tdwell\ton\ttheir\tmistakes\t–\trather\tthey\tlook\tat\tmistakes\tand\tlosses\tas\tlearning\nopportunities.\tWhile\tit’s\ttrue\tthat\tno\tone\tlikes\tto\tlose,\tthe\tway\tyou\tchoose\tto\tthink\tabout\tyour\tlosses\ndictates\thow\tmuch\tstress\tand\ttilt\tyou\twill\texperience.\tAlso,\tif\tyou\tbelieve\tthat\tyou\tcan\tultimately\tbe\nsuccessful,\tyou’ll\tstay\tmotivated\tto\twork\ton\tyour\tgame.\nIn\tgeneral,\tthe\tresilient\tperson\texhibits\tthe\tfollowing\t(Giordano,\t1996):\n\tSelf-discipline\n\tPerseverance\n\tSelf-confidence\n\tFlexibility\n\tPositivity\n\tResourcefulness\n\tLevel\theadedness\n\tOptimism\nAccording\tto\tSuzanne\tKobasa,\tone\tof\tthe\tworld’s\tleading\tresilience\tresearchers,\tthere\tare\tthree\nelements\tthat\tare\tessential\tto\tresilience:\n\tChallenge\t–\tResilient\tpeople\tsee\tdifficulties\tas\tchallenges\tthat\tcan\tbe\tlearned\tfrom.\tThey\tdon’t\tsee\ndifficulties\tas\ta\tpersonal\treflection\tof\ttheir\tabilities\tand\tare\table\tto\tkeep\ttheir\tself-worth\tintact.\nNon-resilient\tpeople\tsee\tproblems\tas\toverwhelming\tand\ttend\tto\tgive\tup\teasily.\n\tCommitment\t–\tResilient\tpeople\tshow\thigh\tlevels\tof\tcommitment\tto\ttheir\tgoals,\tand\tthey\thave\tgoals\tin\nall\tareas\tof\ttheir\tlives.\tHaving\tgoals\tfor\twork,\tplay,\tand\tfamily\tallows\ta\tsense\tof\tbalance.\tBeing\ntruly\tcommitted\tto\tyour\tgame\tmakes\tit\tless\tlikely\tthat\tyou’ll\tgive\tup\twhen\tthe\tgoing\tgets\ttough.\n\tPersonal\tcontrol\t–\tResilient\tpeople\tspend\ttheir\ttime\tand\tenergy\tfocusing\ton\tthose\tvariables\tthat\tthey\ncan\tcontrol.\tFocusing\ton\tcontrollable\tfactors\thelps\tyou\tto\tkeep\tyour\tconfidence\twhereas\tfocusing\non\tuncontrollable\tthings\tincreases\tstress\tand\tanxiety.\tAlways\tremind\tyourself\tto\tfocus\ton\twhat\tyou\nhave\tcontrol\tover.\nIt’s\timportant\tto\tnote\tthat\tresilience\tis\tnot\tan\tinnate\tcapacity.\tRather,\tit\tdevelops\tover\ttime.\tEvery\nperson\thas\tsome\tlevel\tof\tresilience\tpotential\tthat\tcan\tbe\tdeveloped.\tFinding\tyourself\tin\tchallenging\nsituations\tis\tthe\tprecursor\tto\tthe\tdevelopment\tof\tresilience.\tSome\tpeople\tcrumble\tin\ttrying\ttimes\twhile\nothers\tflourish.\tA\tkey\tfactor\tin\twhether\tor\tnot\tyou’ll\tdevelop\tresilience\tis\tyour\tlevel\tof\toptimism.\nMartin\tSeligman\t(1991)\thas\tspent\this\tcareer\tstudying\tthe\timpact\ton\thappiness\tof\twhat\the\tcalls\tour\nexplanatory\tstyle,\tand\thas\tfound\tthat\thow\twe\texplain\tour\tsetbacks\tto\tourselves\tdetermines\tour\tfeelings\nand\tour\tlevel\tof\tresilience.\tSeligman\tbegan\this\tcareer\tworking\ton\tlearned\thelplessness\tand\the\tconcluded\nthat\tlearned\thelplessness\tis\ta\tpsychological\tcondition\twhere\ta\tperson\thas\tlearned\tto\tact\tor\tbehave\nhelplessly\tin\ta\tparticular\tsituation\tthough\tthey\tactually\thave\tthe\tpower\tto\tchange\tthe\tunpleasant',  Document(page_content='circumstances.\tThis\tresearch\tlater\tevolved\tinto\this\twork\ton\toptimism\tand\tpessimism\twhich\the\tcalls\tone’s\nattributional\tstyle.\tGenerally\tspeaking,\tyour\tattributional\tstyle\tdetermines\tto\twhat\tyou\tattribute\tyour\ncircumstances.\nAnother\tway\tto\tthink\tof\tit\tis\thow\tyou\texplain\tto\tyourself\twhy\tyou\texperience\ta\tparticular\tevent.\tDid\nyou\tlose\tbecause\tyou\tare\ta\tloser\tor\tbecause\tyou\tgot\tunlucky?\tThe\tway\tyou\tanswer\tthis\tquestion\ttells\ta\ngreat\tdeal\tabout\twhether\tyou\tare\tan\toptimist\tor\ta\tpessimist.\tDo\tyou\tgenerally\texpect\tgood\toutcomes\tand\nbelieve\tthings\twill\tgo\tin\tyour\tfavor?\tIf\tso,\tthat\tmakes\tyou\tan\toptimist\tand\tthis\tattributional\tstyle\tis\nassociated\twith\tsome\tvery\tpositive\toutcomes\tincluding\tresilience\tand\tmental\ttoughness.\tIf\tyou\texpect\tbad\noutcomes\tand\tfeel\tas\tthough\tthings\tnever\twork\tout\tfor\tyou,\tthen\tyou\tare\ta\tpessimist.\tIt\tis\thard\tto\tbe\nmentally\ttough\tif\tyou\tbelieve\tthat\tthings\tare\tnever\tgoing\tto\tturn\taround\tfor\tyou.\nAccording\tto\tSeligman\t(1991),\tthere\tare\tthree\t“P”s\tthat\tdetermine\twhether\tor\tnot\tyou\tare\tan\toptimist\nand\thow\tresilient\tyou\tare\tlikely\tto\tbe.\tThey\tare:\n\t\nPermanence\n\t–\tPeople\twho\tare\toptimistic\ttend\tto\tsee\tthe\teffects\tof\tbad\tevents\tas\ttemporary\trather\nthan\tpermanent.\tThey\trealize\tthat\tthings\tare\tbound\tto\tchange.\tIf\tyou\tbelieve\tthat\tyou\tare\tgoing\tto\trun\nbad\tforever\tthat\tprobably\twon’t\tengender\tpositive\tfeelings.\tThinking\t“I\talways\tlose\tmy\tflips”\tis\nanother\texample\tof\tthis\ttype\tof\tthinking.\n\t\nPervasiveness\n\t–\tResilient\tpoker\tplayers\tdon’t\tlet\tsetbacks\tor\tbad\tevents\taffect\tother\tunrelated\tareas\nof\ttheir\tlives.\tThey\tare\tclear\tthat\trunning\tpoorly\tat\tpoker\tdoes\tnot\thave\tto\tsour\tother\tgood\taspects\nof\ttheir\tlives.\n\t\nPersonalization\n\t–\tPlayers\twho\thave\tresilien oc,\tso\tare\tyou\treally\tgoing\tto\ttell\tme\twhat’s\twrong\nwith\tme?”\twould\tbe\tan\tappropriate\tresponse\tto\tsuch\ta\tterrible\tdiagnosis.\tInstead,\twhen\tyour\tdoctor\tsays\nthat\tyou\thave\tthe\tflu,\tgives\tyou\tantibiotics,\tand\ttells\tyou\tto\trest,\tyou’re\ta\tlot\thappier\tbecause\tyou\tknow\nwhy\tyou\tfeel\tthat\tway\tand\twhat’s\tgoing\tto\tcure\tit.\nIn\taddition\tto\tanger,\tthere\tare\tother\tmental\tgame\tissues\tthat\tcan\tcause\tyou\tto\tplay\tbadly.\tMany\tplayers\nstruggle\tto\tdeal\twith\tfear,\tlaziness,\toverconfidence,\tloss\tof\tconfidence,\tprocrastination,\tanxiety\tand\ta\tlack\nof\tfocus.\tThe\tkey\tis\tto\tdetermine\twhether\tyour\tpoor\tplay\tis\tcaused\tby\tanger\tor\tanother\tmental\tgame\tissue,\nbecause\teach\tone\trequires\ta\tdifferent\tstrategy\tto\tsolve\tit.\tOnce\tyou\tknow\tthe\tcause\tof\tyour\tpoor\tplay,\nyou’re\ta\tstep\tcloser\tto\tgetting\tthe\tcorrect\tprescription.\nThis\tchapter\tfocuses\tonly\ton\ttilt.\tAfter\treading\tit,\tyou\twill\thave\tthe\tmost\tup-to-date\texplanation\tof\thow\nto\tbreak\ttilt\tdown\tand\tcorrect\tit.\nTilt\tmyths\nFor\tyou\tto\thave\ta\tchance\tat\tsolving\tyour\ttilt\tproblems\tyou\tneed\tgood\tinformation\tabout\ttilt.\tOnly\twhen\nyou\tunderstand\ttilt\tand\tthe\tnature\tof\tanger\tcan\tyou\tbegin\tto\tcorrect\tthe\tunderlying\tflaws\tthat\tcause\tit.\nOtherwise,\tyour\tefforts\twill\tonly\tproduce\tshort-term\tprogress\tthat\twill\teventually\thave\tyou\ttilting\nbecause\tyou’re\tstill\tangry!\nLet’s\tdispel\tsome\tpopular\tmyths\tabout\ttilt\tand\tjumpstart\tyour\tefforts\tto\tkill\tthis\tproblem\tfor\tgood.\tHere\nare\tthe\tones\tthat\tare\tmost\tcommon\tand\tdamaging.\nQuitting\tis\ta\tcure\nQuitting\tis\ta\tway\tto\tprotect\tyourself\tfrom\tthe\tdamage\tthat\ttilt\tcan\tinflict\ton\tyour\tgame,\tand\tit’s\ta\twise\nstrategy\tto\tuse\tuntil\tyou\tlearn\tto\tcontrol\tit.\tThe\tproblem\tis\tthat\tsome\tplayers\tget\tso\tgood\tat\tquitting\tat\tthe\nfirst\tsign\tof\ttilt\tthat,\  Document(page_content='Hate-losing\ttilt\nWhile\tlosing\tis\ta\treality\tin\tany\tcompetitive\tenvironment,\tit\tis\tespecially\ttrue\tin\tpoker.\tWhat\tother\tgame\ncan\tyou\tthink\tof\twhere\tyou\thave\tto\tlose\tas\toften\tas\tyou\tdo\tin\tpoker?\tI\tcan’t\tthink\tof\tone.\tDespite\tthat\nreality\tin\tpoker,\tmany\tplayers\tget\thighly\ttilted\tfrom\tlosing.\tThose\tplayers\tare\tmost\toften\tincredibly\ncompetitive\tand,\tfor\tthat\treason,\tanother\tterm\tfor\tthis\tis\t“competitive\ttilt”.\tPlayers\twith\tthis\ttype\tof\ttilt\nare\tso\tcompetitive\tthat\tthey\tcannot\thandle\tlosing\tno\tmatter\thow\tit\thappens.\tJust\tthe\tfact\tthat\tthey\tlost\tis\nenough\tto\tmake\tthem\tinsanely\tangry.\tEven\tif\tthey\thave\ta\tgood\thandle\ton\thow\tmuch\tvariance\timpacts\nshort-term\tresults\tin\tpoker,\tthey\tstill\tcan’t\tstand\tlosing.\tTo\tbe\tclear,\tbeing\tcompetitive\tand\twanting\tto\twin\nare\tnot\tproblems.\tThe\tproblem\tis\thow\tyou\thandle\tthe\tinevitable\tlosses…\toften\thandling\tthem\tso\tbadly\nyou\tend\tup\tlosing\tmore\tas\ta\tresult.\nMistake\ttilt\nPoker\tis\ta\tgame\twhere\tevery\tplayer,\teven\tthe\tbest\tin\tthe\tworld,\twill\tmake\tmistakes.\tThe\tproblem\tisn’t\nthat\tyou\tmake\tmistakes,\tit’s\tthat\tyou\tbeat\tyourself\tup\tfor\tmaking\tone.\tMaybe\tyou\tfelt\tlike\tyou\tknew\twhat\nthe\tcorrect\tplay\twas,\tand\tyou’re\ttilted\tbecause\tfor\tsome\treason\tyou\tdidn’t\texecute\tit.\tYou\tmay\teven\tbeat\nyourself\tup\tfor\ta\tmistake\tthat\twasn’t\teven\ta\tmistake\t–\tlike\twhen\tyou\tplay\ta\thand\twell\tand\tget\tunlucky.\nMaybe\tyou’re\ttilted\tbecause\tyou\tmade\tsuch\tan\tobvious\tand\tterrible\tplay\t(one\tthat\tcould\tonly\thappen\tfrom\nalready\tbeing\ton\ttilt),\tbut\tyou\tdidn’t\trealize\tthat\ttilt\tcould\tforce\tsuch\tpoor\tdecision-making.\tOr,\tstrangely,\nquite\ta\tcommon\ttype\tof\tmistake\ttilt\t–\tyou\thate\tit\twhen\tyour\topponents\tplay\tpoorly.\tAn\texample\tis\twhen\ta\nmistake\tby\ta\tnormally\tstrong\tplayer\tends\tup\tcosting\tyou\tmoney.\tThere\tare\tmany\treasons\tto\tbe\tannoyed\nwith\tmistakes\tand\toften\tplayers\taren’t\treally\taware\tof\tthis\ttype\tof\ttilt.\tAnger\tat\tmaking\tmistakes\t–\nwhatever\tthe\treasons\tfor\tthe\tmistake\t–\tis\toften\ta\tsign\tthat\tyou\thave\ta\tflawed\tunderstanding\tof\tthe\tlearning\nprocess.\tUnderstanding\tthe\tlearning\tprocess\tisn’t\tsomething\tthat\tmany\tpeople\twere\ttaught.\tOnce\tyou\tfix\nthese\tflaws,\tyou’re\ta\tlot\tcloser\tto\tsolving\tthis\ttype\tof\ttilt.\nEntitlement\ttilt\nThis\ttype\tof\ttilt\tis\tcaused\tby\tthe\tbelief\tthat\tyou\tdeserve\tto\twin.\tIn\tessence,\tyou\tview\twinning\tas\ta\npossession\tthat\tyou\tbelieve\tis\trightfully\tyours\tand\tyou\ttilt\twhen\tsomeone\tundeserving\trobs\tit\tfrom\tyou.\n“I’m\tsupposed\tto\twin\tagainst\tfish,”\tyou\tthink\tto\tyourself\tafter\ta\tsession\twhere\tyou\tplayed\tgreat\tand\tlost.\n“How\tcan\tyou\tmake\tsuch\ta\tterrible\tplay?\tYou\tdon’t\teven\tbelong\tat\tthe\tsame\ttable\tas\tme,”\tyou\tmutter\tto\nyourself\tas\tyour\tchips\tget\tstacked\tby\tan\tinferior\tplayer.\t“The\tcards\tshouldn’t\tmatter,\tI\tcan\toutplay\thim,”\nyou\tbelieve\tsubconsciously,\tbut\tdon’t\tallow\tyourself\tto\tsay.\tThe\tinteresting\tthing\tabout\tentitlement\ttilt\tis\nthat\tit\toften\tmakes\tpeople\tseem\treally\tarrogant,\twhen\tthey’re\tnot\tat\tall.\tThere’s\tjust\tsomething\tabout\npoker\tthat\tbrings\tthat\tside\tout.\tBelieving\tthat\tyou’re\tsuch\ta\tgood\tplayer\tthat\tyou\tshould\twin\tall\tthe\ttime\ndoesn’t\tjust\tshow\tyour\tdisregard\tfor\tvariance,\tit\tis\talso\ta\tgreat\texample\tof\twhat\thappens\twhen\tyou\thave\ntoo\tmuch\tconfidence.\tThat’s\tright,\toverconfidence\tis\ta\tproblem\tthat\tdoesn’t\tget\ta\tlot\tof\tattention,\tbut\tcan\nbe\ta\tbig\tproblem\tin\tpoker.\nRevenge\ttilt\nRevenge\tis\tcommon\tin\teveryday\tlife,\tso\tthere\tshould\tbe\tno\tsurprise\tthat\tit\tshould\tbe\tcommon\tin\tpoker\tas\nwell.\tThere\tare\tmany\treasons\tto\tseek\trevenge\tin\tpoker.\tFor\texample,\tanother\tplayer\thas\tbeen\tparticularly\naggressive\tagainst\tyou\tand\tyou\tfeel\tyou’ve\tbeen\tdisrespected.\tOr\tyour\topponent\tthinks\tthey’re\tbetter\tthan', .\tIf\tyou\tdon’t\nrecognize\tthat\tyou’re\ttilting\tuntil\tyour\tanger\tis\talready\treally\thigh,\tthe\temotional\tsystem\twill\thave\talready\nshut\tdown\tyour\tability\tto\tthink.\tAnd\tthinking\tis\tyour\tprimary\tweapon\tagainst\ttilt.\tTo\tcounteract\tthis\tI\thave\nall\tmy\tclients\tcreate\ta\ttilt\tprofile,\twhich\tis\ta\tsimple\tdescription\tof\tthe\tunique\tway\tthat\tthey\ttilt.\tDespite\nmany\tcommonalities,\tevery\tplayer\ttilts\tin\tslightly\tdifferent\tways\tand\tfor\tdifferent\treasons.\tOne\tplayer\nmight\tfeel\tphysically\tangry\tin\tthe\tpit\tof\ttheir\tstomach\tand\tstart\tplaying\tpassively,\tanother\tplayer\tmight\tget\nhot-headed\tand\tbegin\tto\tre-raise\tevery\tbet.\tThe\tpurpose\tof\tthe\ttilt\tprofile\tis\tto\tdefine\tthe\tunique\tways\tthat\nyou\ttilt\tso\tyou\tcan\tclearly\trecognize\tthe\tearly\twarning\tsigns\tand\tgive\tyourself\tthe\tbest\todds\tto\tcontrol\ttilt.\nFortunately,\ttilt\thappens\tin\ta\tpredictable\tpattern\tand\tfor\tpredictable\treasons.\tUse\tthe\tquestions\tbelow\nas\ta\tguide\tto\tbegin\tanalyzing\tand\tidentifying\tthe\tdetails\tof\tyour\ttilt.\tIf\tspecifics\tare\thard\tto\tfind\tat\tfirst,\ndon’t\tworry,\tcontinue\tto\tthink\tand\tstudy\tyour\tpattern\tuntil\tyou’re\table\tto\tidentify\twhat\twas\tpreviously\nunknown.\n\tWhat\tcauses\tyou\tto\ttilt?\t(bad\tbeats,\tlosing\tto\tfish,\trunning\tbad,\tetc.)\n\tWhat\tdo\tyou\tsay\tto\tyourself,\tout\tloud\tor\tto\tother\tplayers,\twhen\ttilting?\n\tHow\tdoes\tyour\tbody\treact\tto\ttilt?\t(head\tbecomes\thot,\tbody\tis\tsweaty,\theart\traces,\tfists\tare\tclenched,\netc.)\n\tWhat\tis\tthe\tfirst\tsign\tof\ttilt\tthat\tyou\tnotice?', \toperations\ton\tpatients\twithout\tthe\tuse\tof\tany\npain\tkillers.\tEsdaile\teventually\tperformed\tover\t200\toperations\tusing\tthis\ttechnique.\tEsdaile’s\nachievements\tprovided\tthe\twestern\tmedical\tworld\twith\tevidence\tof\tthe\tpower\tand\tpractical\tpurpose\tof\nhypnosis\tas\ta\tmedical\ttool,\tfrom\ta\tpractitioner\twho\twas\tnot\tconsidered\ta\tcharlatan.\nAnother\timportant\tdiscovery\twas\tmade\tby\tDr.\tÉtienne\tAzam\tin\tthe\t1800s.\tAzam\tis\tnoted\tfor\this\ndiscovery\tof\tthe\tsplitting\tof\tthe\tconscious.\tThis\twas\tan\timportant\tstep\tforward\tfor\tthe\tsubject\tof\nhypnotism,\tas\tthe\tpractitioner\twas\tnow\taware\tthat\the\tcould\ttalk\tdirectly\tto\tthe\tsubconscious\tand,',  Document(page_content='1)\tI\tinduce\tthe\tplayer\tinto\ta\tstate\tof\thypnosis.\n2)\tI\task\tplayers\tto\tpicture\tthemselves\tas\tthe\tcasino\tmanager\trunning\ta\tgame\tof\troulette.\tI\thave\tthem\tvisualize\tthe\tgamblers\tgetting\nlucky\tand\thitting\ttheir\tnumbers.\tI\tthen\task\thow\ta\tcasino\tfeels\tif\ta\tgambler\tgets\tlucky\tand\twins\tin\troulette.\tIn\tmost\tcases\tthe\tplayer\nexplains\tthat\tthey\tare\thappy,\tas\tit\tencourages\tother\tgamblers\tto\tcontinue\tplaying\tthe\tgame.\tHowever,\tthis\tdoes\tnot\thave\ta\tnegative\nimpact\ton\tthe\tcasino\tbecause\tit\tis\twell\tbankrolled\tand\thas\tan\tedge.\n3)\tI\task\tthe\tplayer\tto\tcompare\tthis\tsituation\tto\ta\tprofessional\tpoker\tplayer\ttaking\ta\tbad\tbeat\tat\tthe\ttable.\tI\thave\tthem\tmake\tthe\nconnection\tbetween\tthemselves\twith\tan\tedge\tat\tthe\ttable\tand\tthe\tedge\tthat\tthe\tcasino\thas.\tFrequently,\tthe\tplayer\tbelieves\tthey\thave\ta\nmore\tsignificant\tedge\tthan\tthe\tcasino’s\t5.26%\t(American\tRoulette).\tI\texplain\tthat\tbad\tbeats\tare\tjust\ta\tway\tto\tencourage\tweak\tplayers\tto\nreturn\tand\tthat\tthey\tare\tactually\tinvesting\tin\ttheir\tbusiness\tevery\ttime\tthey\tare\ton\tthe\tlosing\tend\tof\ta\tbad\tbeat\tat\tthe\ttable.\tIf\tthey\tbelieve\nthe\tcasino\tdoes\tnot\tneed\tto\tbe\tangry\twhen\tlosing\tto\ta\tgambler,\tthere\tis\tno\treason\tfor\tthem\tto\tbe\tangry\tat\tthe\tpoker\ttable\teither.\tVariance\nmakes\tpoker\tprofitable\tfor\tthe\tprofessional\tin\tpoker\tin\tthe\tsame\tway\tit\tmakes\troulette\tprofitable\tfor\tthe\tcasino.\tThe\tgambler\tis\tinterested\nin\tthe\tresults\tof\ta\tsession,\tnot\tan\tindividual\thand,\tjust\tas\tthe\tcasino\tis\tinterested\tin\tquarterly\tincome,\tnot\tan\tindividual\tplayer’s\tresults.\n4)\tI\task\tthe\tplayer\tto\tsee\thimself\tas\tthe\tcasino\twhile\the\tplays\tand\tfocus\ton\tsmiling\twhen\the\tsees\tbad\tbeats,\taccepting\tthat\tit\tis\nevidence\tthat\the\twas\tplaying\tcorrectly\tand\tthat\tit\tis\tan\tin ection,\tI\tdiscuss\nhow\tto\tutilize\tself-hypnosis,\thow\tto\tuse\tthat\tstate\tto\timprove\tyour\tpoker\tand\thow\tto\tmake\tchanges\tin\nother\tareas\tof\tyour\tlife.\nSelf-hypnosis\tis\tan\texcellent\tway\tto\tmove\tyour\tlife\tand,\tin\tthis\tcase,\tyour\tpoker\tgame\tin\ta\tmore\npositive\tdirection.\tIt\tis\ta\ttool\tyou\tcan\tuse\tto\twork\ton\tany\tmindset\tleaks,\timprove\tfocus,\tvisualize\tyour\ngoals\tand\tvisualize\tyour\tpath\tto\treaching\tthat\tfuture\tsuccess.\nIdeally,\tprior\tto\tattempting\tself-hypnosis,\tdownload\tthe\tfree\tMP3\tfrom\tmy\twebsite\tand\tlisten\tto\tit\ta\ncouple\tof\ttimes\tso\tthat\tyou\thave\tan\tunderstanding\tof\tthe\tstate\tthat\tyou\twant\tto\tachieve.\tActivating\tand',  Document(page_content='We\tknow\tthat\ttilt\tis\ta\tpersonal\tresponse.\tWhile\tthere\tare\tcommon\tthings\tthat\ttilt\tplayers\tat\tthe\ttable,\nthere\tare\tno\tevents\tthat\tare\tguaranteed\tto\tput\tevery\tplayer\ton\ttilt.\tSome\tplayers\tcan\teasily\tdeal\twith\ttheir\nA-A\tbeing\tcracked,\tand\tothers\tin\tthe\tsame\tsituation\twill\treact\tterribly.\tEveryone\tseems\tto\thave\tdifferent\ntriggers\tfor\ttilt\tand\twhen\tlooking\tto\tresolve\tthis\ttilt,\twe\tmust\tfirst\tunderstand\twhere\tit\tcomes\tfrom.\nThe\tchart\tabove\tshows\thow\tanxieties,\tphantom\tpain,\tpanic\tattacks\tand\tsome\tstress-related\tillnesses\ncan\tbe\tformed.\tThe\ttilt\twe\tsee\tat\tthe\ttable\tis\tformed\tin\tthe\tsame\tway.\nWhen\tyour\tmind\tgenerates\ttilt\tat\tthe\ttable,\tit\tis\tpicking\tup\tthat\tresponse\tfrom\tbehavior\tlearned\tby\tyour\nsubconscious.\tAs\twe\tdiscussed\tearlier,\tthe\tplayer\tuncomfortable\twith\tbeing\t3-bet\t(at\ta\tsubconscious\nlevel)\tis\toften\tconnecting\tthe\tsituation\tto\tbeing\tbullied\tat\tschool.\tThe\tplayer\tscreaming\tand\tshouting\tat\tthe\ndealer\tis\toften\tbrought\tup\tin\ta\thousehold\twhere\tissues\tare\tresolved\twith\taggression.\nI\twill\tdescribe\tan\texample\tof\ta\tphobia\tbeing\tcreated\tthrough\tthis\tprocess.\tWe\twill\twork\tbackwards\nfrom\tthe\tfear,\tas\tthat\tis\ttypically\thow\ta\thypnotherapy\tsession\twill\twork.\nFear\tof\tspiders\nA\tclient\thas\ta\tfear\tof\tspiders\tand\tcomes\tto\ta\thypnotherapist\tto\thelp\twith\tthe\tissue.\nThe\thypnotherapist\tdoes\tthe\tinitial\tconsultation\twith\tthe\thypnotic\tinduction\tand\tstarts\tto\twork\tthrough\nthe\tfear.\nThe\thypnotherapist\thas\tthe\tclient\timagine\ta\trecent\ttime\tthe\tclient\tremembers\tbeing\tscared\tof\tspiders\nand\thow\tthat\tfelt.\tUsually,\tthis\twill\tbe\tsomething\tlike,\t“There\twas\ta\tlarge\tspider\tin\tthe\tsink,\tI\tscreamed\nand\tfelt\tmy\tchest\tcontract,\tmy\tbreathing\tquicken\tand\tpulse\tincrease.”\tThe\tclient\tis\tdirected\tto\tan\tearlier\nmemory\tof\tfeeling\tthat\tway.\tUsually\twith\ta\tstatement\tlike:\n“I’ll\tnow\tcount\tyou\tback\tfrom\tfive\tto\tone\tand\tyou’ll\tremember\tanother\tconnected\tmemory,\tanother\ttime\nyou\tfelt\tthat\tsame\tway.”\nThe\tnext\tmemory\tis\ttypically\ta\tsecondary\tsensitizing\tevent\t(“SSE”).\tThis\tcould\tbe\tsomething\tlike,\t“I\nwas\t15.\tA\tboy\tin\tschool\tthrew\ta\tspider\tat\tme,\tand\tI\twas\tterrified.”\tThese\tsecondary\tevents\tare\tthe\tevents\nthat\tprove\tto\tthe\tindividual\ttheir\tfear\tis\tjustified.\tEach\ttime\tthere\tis\tevidence\tthat\ta\tfear\thas\tvalue,\tit\nincreases\tthe\tphobia\t(think\tof\tthe\tclaustrophobic\tperson\tstuck\tin\tan\televator,\tor\ta\tbulimic\tperson\tbeing\ncalled\toverweight).\tThe\tSSEs\tbuild\tand\tcreate\tcumulative\ttrauma,\tamplifying\tany\temotional\tresponses.', .\tDownswings\tcan\thaunt\tplayers.\tRemembering\tthe\tfeelings\tof\ta\tbad\ndownswing\tcan\tbe\ta\tsource\tof\tstress\tat\tthe\ttable\tand\thave\ta\thuge\timpact\ton\tthe\tvolume\tplayed.\tBlack\nFriday\tand\tits\taftermath\thas\talso\taffected\ta\tlarge\tportion\tof\tthe\tonline\tcommunity,\twith\tmany\tplayers\nlosing\tfaith\tin\tonline\tpoker\tbecause\tthey\tfeel\tanxiety\taround\tthe\tsafety\tof\ttheir\tfunds.\nAs\twith\tthe\tother\tissues\tcovered,\tthe\tkey\tto\tresolving\tanxiety\tat\tthe\ttable\tis\tto\tunderstand\tits\tsource\tand', isit:\nHoldemBook.com',  Document(page_content='GREAT\tPLAYS\tFROM\tTHE\tGREAT\tPLAYERS\nYou\tare\tyour\town\tcompany,\tyour\town\tboss\tand\tyou\tmake\tall\tthe\tdecisions\tregarding\tthe\tcompany.\tYou\nwork\twhen\tyou\twant,\tplay\twhatever\tgames\tand\tstakes\tyou\twant,\tpromote\tyourself\twhen\tyou\twant\n(meaning\tplaying\thigher\tstakes),\tand\tmanage\tall\tthe\tcompany’s\tmoney.\tAnd\ttrust\tme,\tthe\tmoney\nmanagement\tpart\tis\tas\timportant,\tif\tnot\tmore\tso,\tthan\tbeing\ta\tgreat\tplayer.\nI’ve\thad\tthe\tprivilege\tto\tbe\taround\tthe\tmost\tsuccessful\tpoker\tplayers\tover\tmany\tyears.\tI’m\toften\tasked,\n“Who\tare\tthe\tgreatest\tpoker\tplayers\tof\tall\ttime?”\tMy\tanswer\tto\tthat\tquestion\tis\tthe\tsame\tone\tI\theard\nDoyle\tBrunson\tgive\ta\treporter\twhen\the\twas\tonce\tasked\tthat\tquestion.\tDoyle\tsaid,\t“You\tjudge\ta\thunter\tby\nthe\tnumber\tof\tfurs\the\tbrings\thome.”\tIn\tthe\told\tdays,\tit\twas\tthe\tsuccessful\thigh\tstakes\tcash\tgame\tplayers\nand\ttoday,\tin\taddition\tto\tthem,\tit’s\tthe\tmost\tsuccessful\ttournament\tplayers\t(especially\tthose\twinning\tthe\nHi-Roller\tevents).\nYou\tshould\trecognize\tthat\tfor\tthe\tmost\tpart,\tas\tthe\tstakes\tget\thigher,\tthe\tplayers\tget\tbetter.\nThere\tare\tmany\tfactors\tto\tbeing\ta\tsuccessful\tpoker\tplayer.\tOne\tof\tthose\tis\tone\tyou\tmight\tnot\thave\nthought\tmuch\tabout\t–\tdon’t\tbe\tafraid\tof\twinning.\tYears\tago,\tI\twas\tat\tthe\tMirage\ttalking\tto\tChip\tReese\t(the\nyoungest\tplayer\tever\tinducted\tinto\tthe\tPoker\tHall\tof\tFame)\twhen\ta\tbusinessman\tfrom\tBeverly\tHills\twho\nknew\tChip\tcame\tover\tand\tsaid,\t“Chip,\tdo\tyou\twant\tto\tplay\tsome\t$1,000/$2,000\tSeven\tCard\tStud?”\tChip\nsaid,\t“Sure.”\tThey\tstarted\tplaying\tand\tthe\tother\tguy\twas\tcatching\tall\tthe\tcards.\tIn\ta\thalf\thour,\tthe\tguy\twas\nup\t$28,000.\tHe\tstarted\tlooking\tat\this\twatch\tand\tthen\tsaid,\t“Chip,\tI’m\tsorry\tbut\tI\tpromised\tmy\twife\tI’d\nmeet\ther\tfor\tlunch.\tI’ve\tgot\t  Document(page_content='Number\tone\ttrait\nIf\tyou\tasked\ttop\tplayers\twhat\tthe\tnumber\tone\ttrait\tof\ta\tgreat\tpoker\tplayer\tis,\tmost\twould\tsay,\t“They\thave\nto\thave\theart.”\tIn\tother\twords,\tthey\tfight\tfor\tpots\tand\twin\ta\tnumber\tof\tthem\twithout\thaving\tthe\tbest\thand.\nBluffing\tin\tbig\tbet\tpoker\t(pot-limit\tand\tno-limit)\tis\ta\tpowerful\tasset\tto\ta\tpoker\tplayer\twhen\tit’s\tdone\nright.\nRecognize\tthis\tabout\tbluffing\t–\tif\tyou\tget\tcalled\tevery\ttime\tyou\tbluff,\tyou’re\tbluffing\ttoo\tmuch\tand\tif\tyou\tnever\tget\tcalled,\nyou’re\tnot\tbluffing\tenough.\nHere\tare\tsome\tterrific\tbluffs\tI’ve\thad\tthe\topportunity\tto\twitness.\nFiring\tthree\tshells\nBetting\ton\tthe\tflop,\tturn\tand\triver\tis\teasy\tto\tdo\twhen\tyou\thave\ta\thand\tbut\tnot\tso\teasy\tto\tdo\twhen\tyou\tare\ngetting\tcalled\tall\tthe\tway.\tStu\tUngar\twas\tplaying\tin\ta\t$100/$200\tno-limit\thold’em\tcash\tgame\tat\tVegas\nWorld\t(where\tthe\tStratosphere\tnow\tsits)\tduring\tthe\tAmerica’s\tCup\tof\tPoker.\tI\twas\twalking\tby\tthe\ttable\nand\the\tsaid,\t“Sexton,\tcome\tsweat\tme\tfor\ta\twhile.”\tWell,\tthat\twas\talways\tfun,\tso\tI\ttook\ta\tseat.\tAbout\tthe\nthird\thand\tafter\tI\tsat\tdown,\tStuey\tpicks\tup\t6\n-4\n,\twas\tfirst\tto\tspeak\tand\traises\tto\t$700.\tOne\tguy\tcalls\tin\nthe\tcutoff\tseat.\tThe\tflop\tcomes\tJ-10-2\trainbow.\tStuey\t(with\t$25,000\tin\tfront\tof\thim)\tbets\t$800.\tHis\nopponent\t(with\t$20,000)\tcalls.\tAn\toffsuit\t7\tcomes\ton\tthe\tturn.\tStuey\tbets\t$1,700\tand\tthe\tguy\tcalls.\tOn\tthe\nriver,\tthe\tboard\tpairs\tdeuces\t(board\tnow\treads\tJ-10-2-7-2)\tand\tStuey,\twith\this\t6-4,\tbets\t$4,200.\tHis\nopponent\tnow\tgoes\tin\tthe\ttank.\tAfter\ta\tfew\tminutes,\the\tshows\tthe\tA\n-10\n\tand\tfolds.\tAs\tStuey\twas\traking\nin\tthe\tchips,\the\tturns\tto\tme\tand\twhispers,\t“A\tlot\tof\tguys\twill\tbluff\tat\ta\tpot.\tSome\twill\teven\tfire\ta\tsecond\nshell,\tbut\tthere’s\tnot\tmany\twho\twi e\tbetting\tas\the\tnow\tbet\t375,000.\tTony\tcalled\nagain\tand\this\teyes\topened\twide\tas\the\tsaw\tGalen’s\thand.\nBeing\taggressive\twins\tyou\ta\tlot\tof\tpots\tyou\twouldn’t\totherwise\twin.', stBet\tOpen\tin\tJacksonville,\tFL,\tthe\tblinds\twere\t15,000/30,000-5,000\twhen\tDarren\nElias\t(with\t1,200,000)\traised\tit\tto\t65,000\tup\tfront\twith\tA-K.\tJames\tCalderaro\t(with\t2,200,000)\tright\nbehind\thim\tmade\tthe\tcall\twith\t8\n-7\n\tand\teveryone\telse\tfolded.\tThe\tflop\twas\tA-10-2\trainbow.\tElias\tbet\n75,000\tand\tCalderaro,\tin\tan\teffort\tto\ttake\tthe\tpot\taway,\traised\tit\tto\t195,000!\tElias\tcalled.\tOoops!\tThe\nturn\tcard\twas\tthe\t5\n,\tgiving\tCalderaro\ta\tflush\tdraw.\tBoth\tplayers\tchecked.\tRaising\ton\tthe\tflop\tgets\tyou\ta\nfree\tcard\ton\tthe\tturn\tmost\tof\tthe\ttime.\tThe\tQ\n\tcame\ton\tthe\triver.\tElias\tchecked\tand\tCalderaro\tbet\n260,000.\tElias\tpaid\thim\toff\tand\tdid\ta\tdouble-take\twhen\the\tsaw\twhat\tCalderaro\traised\thim\twith\ton\tthe\nflop.\tAttempted\tsteals\tare\tfine\tbut\tgetting\tlucky\tto\thit\trunner,\trunner\tto\twin\tthe\tpot\tis\treally\tsweet.\nTwo\taces\nStu\tUngar\tonce\tsaid\tto\tme,\t“Sexton,\tall\ttwo\taces\tare\tgood\tfor\tis\tto\twin\ta\tsmall\tpot\tor\tlose\ta\tbig\tone.”\tIn\nthe\tSeason\t11\tParx\tOpen\tPoker\tClassic,\tplaying\t20,000/40,000-5,000\tafter\ttwo\tfolds,\tChris\tVanDeursen\n(with\t2,100,000)\topened\tthe\tpot\tfor\t80,000\twith\tthe\t10\n-8\n.\tIt\twas\tfolded\tto\tthe\tsmall\tblind\twhere\nAndre\tNyffeler\t(with\t875,000)\tlooked\tdown\tat\tA-A\tand\tjust\tcalled\t(a\tplay\tI’m\tnot\tfond\tof\tas\tit\tprices\tin\nthe\tbig\tblind;\twith\tbig\tpairs,\tyou\tusually\twant\tto\tcharge\tyour\topponents\tto\tsee\tthe\tflop).\tChris\tLee,\tin\tthe\nbig\tblind\t(with\t2,800,000)\twith\t10-10,\talso\tjust\tcalled!\tThe\tflop\twas\tQ-10-5\trainbow.\tAndre\tled\tout\tfor\n115,000.\tLee,\twith\tthree\ttens,\tjust\tcalled\tas\tdid\tVanDeursen.\tThe\t9\n\tcame\ton\tthe\tturn\tand\tAndre,\twith\this\naces,\tbet\t115,000.\tLee\tnow\traised\tit\tto\t425,000.\tVanDeursen\tfolded\tand\tas\tdid\tLee,\tthrowing\this\taces\naway.\tIt\twas\ta\trare\tcase\twhere\ta\tplayer\t(one\tof\tthe\ttwo\tshort\tstacks\tat\tthe\ttable)\tsaved\tover\thalf\this\tchips\nwith\ttwo\taces.', .\tWhy\tdidn’t\the\traise\non\tthe\tflop?\tAnd\tif\the\thad\ta\tgood\thand,\twhy\twouldn’t\the\tcheck\ton\tthe\tturn?\tChris\tfolded\tand\tAndreas\npicked\tup\tthe\tpot.\tThere’s\tan\told\tpoker\taxiom\tthat\tAndreas\tutilized\there,\t“If\tyou’re\tgoing\tto\tcheck\tand\ncall,\tit’s\tprobably\tbetter\tto\tjust\tlead\tout\tand\tbet.”\tStill,\twhen\tan\topponent’s\taction\tdoesn’t\tpass\tthe\tsmell\ntest,\tyou\tmight\ttry\tdoing\tsomething\tbesides\tfolding.\nFloating:\tan\texpert\tplay\nFloating\tis\twhen\tyou\tcall\ta\tbet\ton\tthe\tflop\twith\tno\thand\tand\tno\tdraw\twith\tthe\tintention\tof\ttaking\tthe\tpot\naway\tfrom\tyour\topponent\ton\ta\tlater\tstreet.\tIt’s\ta\tterrific\tplay\twhen\tapplied\tin\tthe\tright\tsituation\t(for\nexample\t–\twhen\tyou\tknow\tyour\topponent\talways\tmakes\ta\tcontinuation\tbet\tafter\traising\tpreflop\tbut\tthen\nchecks\ton\tthe\tturn\twhen\tcalled\ton\tthe\tflop),\tbut\tit’s\ta\tplay\tthat\tonly\tthe\tbest\tplayers\twill\tuse\tbecause\tit\ntakes\ta\tlot\tof\theart\tto\tmake.\tIt’s\tbeautiful\tto\twatch\twhen\tit\tworks.\nIn\tthe\tSeason\t2\tWPT\tWorld\tChampionship,\twith\tfive\tplayers\tleft\tand\tthe\tblinds\t30,000/60,000-10,000,\naction\twas\tfolded\taround\tto\tMatt\tMatros\t(with\t4,100,000)\tin\tthe\tsmall\tblind\tand\the\tlimped\twith\ta\t7-5\noffsuit.\tHasan\tHabib\t(with\t2,400,000)\twith\ta\t4-3,\tchecked\this\toption.\tThe\tflop\twas\tK-Q-Q.\tMatros\tled\nout\tfor\t100,000\tand\tHabib\tcalled\t(floated)!\tThe\t8\n\tappeared\ton\tthe\tturn\tand\tMatros\tchecked.\tHabib\tnow\nbet\t175,000\tand\twon\tthe\tpot\twhen\tMatros\tfolded.\tHabib\tcorrectly\tfigured\tthat\tif\tMatros\thad\tany\tkings\tor\nqueens\tin\this\thand,\tor\tany\tpair,\the\twould\thave\traised\tpreflop.\tKnowing\tthat,\ta\t“float”\twas\tperfect\tin\tthis\nsituation.\nKnowing\twhen\tto\tcall\nDoyle\tBrunson\thas\tbeen\t“the\tman”\tin\tpoker\tfor\tmany\tyears.\tHe’s\ta\ttwo-time\tWSOP\tworld\tchampion', nblind\tchecked\tand\tDoyle\tbet\t$8,000.\tHis\topponent\tshowed\ta\tjack\tand\tas\the\twas\tfolding\tsaid,\t“Doyle,\nyou’re\tso\tlucky.”\tAs\tDoyle\twas\traking\tin\tthe\tpot,\the\tsmiled\tand\tsaid,\t“I\tknow\tit.”\nThat\thand\tmade\ta\tbig\timpression\ton\tme\tas\tit\tgot\tme\tthinking\tabout\tmaximizing\topportunities.\tDoyle\nknew\tthe\tguy\tmade\ta\tstraight\ton\tthe\tturn\twhen\the\traised\tand\trather\tthan\traise\thim\tback\twith\tthe\tnuts\ton\tthe\nturn,\tas\tmany\tplayers\twould\tdo,\tand\tsplit\tthe\tpot,\the\tjust\tcalled,\thoping\tthe\tboard\twould\tpair\ton\tthe\triver.\nThis\tmight\tgive\thim\ta\tchance\tto\tbet\ton\tthe\triver\tand\twin\tthe\tpot,\twhich\tis\texactly\twhat\thappened.\nThe\t5-bet\nThis\tis\ta\tplay\tthat\tused\tto\tbe\tnon-existent,\tbut\tis\tdeployed\ta\treasonable\tamount\tby\tthe\taggressive\tplayers\nof\ttoday.\tIn\tthe\tSeason\t6\tWPT\tTurks\tand\tCaicos\tPoker\tClassic,\tfive\tplayers\twere\tleft\tat\t5,000/10,000-\n1,000.\tIt\twas\tfolded\taround\tto\tAlan\tSass\t(chip\tleader\twith\t1,000,000)\ton\tthe\tbutton\tand\the\traised\tto\n27,000\twith\tJ\n-8\n.\tErik\tCajelais\t(with\t708,000)\twas\tin\tthe\tsmall\tblind\tand\t3-bet\tto\t75,000\twith\ta\t9-4\noffsuit.\tThe\tbig\tblind\tfolded\tand\tSass\tthen\tcorrectly\tfelt\tCajelais\twas\t3-betting\tweak,\tso\the\t4-bet\tit\tto\n175,000!\tIncredibly,\tCajelais\tthen\t5-bet\tit\tto\t365,000\tand\tSass\tgave\tup.\t(It\tis\ttough\tto\t5-bet\tanytime\twith\nzippidee-do-dah,\tlet\talone\tat\ta\tWPT\tfinal\ttable.)\nA\twhile\tback,\tDaniel\tNegreanu\twas\ttalking\tto\tDoyle\tBrunson\tabout\tthe\tyoung\tguns\twho\t3-,\t4-\tand\t5-\nbet\tpreflop.\tDoyle\tsaid,\t“Daniel,\tI\twant\tto\tmake\tyou\ta\tbet\t–\tand\tlay\t100-to-1\ton\tit.”\tDaniel\tsaid,\t“What\tis\nit?”\tDoyle\tsaid,\t“I\twant\tto\tbet\tthat\tif\tI\tever\t5-bet\tbefore\tthe\tflop,\tmy\topponent\twill\thave\tto\toutdraw\tme\tto\nwin\tthe\tpot\t–\tand\tI’ll\tlay\t100-1\ton\tit.”\tDaniel\tlaughed\tbut\tdidn’t\ttake\tthe\tbet.\n  Document(page_content='CONCLUSION\t\nby\tJonathan\tLittle\nI\thope\tyou\thave\tenjoyed\treading\tthis\tbook.\tI\turge\tyou\tto\tmake\ttime\tto\treread\tit\tmany\ttimes\tthroughout\nyour\tpoker\tcareer.\tSome\tconcepts\tthat\tdid\tnot\tquite\tresonate\twith\tyou\ttoday\tmay\tlead\tyou\tto\ta\tbig\nbreakthrough\tin\tthe\tfuture.\tPoker\tis\ta\tgame\tthat\tconstantly\tevolves\tand\ttherefor\tyour\tgame\tmust\talso\nconstantly\tevolve.\tNo\tone\thas\tcompletely\tmastered\tthe\tgame\tand\tno\tone\tever\twill.\tTo\tcontinue\tyour\ngrowth\tas\ta\tpoker\tplayer,\tI\tstrongly\tsuggest\tyou\tattend\tthe\twebinars\tthat\twill\tbe\tavailable\tstarting\tin\tlate\n2015.\tYou\tcan\tfind\tmore\tinformation\tabout\tthese\tclasses\tat\t\nHoldemBook.com\n.\nIf\tyou\thave\tenjoyed\tthis\tbook,\tplease\trecommend\tit\tto\tyour\tfriends.\tEveryone\twho\thas\tthe\tdrive\tand\nmotivation\tto\twork\thard\tto\tget\tgood\tdeserves\tto\tthrive\tat\tpoker.\tIf\tyou\thave\ta\tfriend\twho\tfits\tin\tthat\ncategory,\tspread\tthe\tknowledge.\nThank\tyou\tfor\treading.', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/excelling-at-no-limit-holdem.pdf', 'page': 311})]

 Document(page_content='3 \n Exclusive Bonus  \n \n \nAs a bonus for purchasing this book, I am making the 15 hands that are presented \nin this book available to you as interactive quizzes.  \nTo access the 15 interactive hand quizzes, visit:  \nhttp://pokercoaching.com/workbook/bonus', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 2}),
 Document(page_content='4 \n Acknowledgments  \nHuge thanks to my business partners Dan Stanley and Albert Hart for helping \nmake this book look presen table . Infinite thanks are owed to Suzan Baroni and \nKen Adams for editing the text. Finally, thanks to you, my students. You inspired \nme to create PokerCoaching.com , which in turn inspired this book. My work \nwould not exist without you. Thank you for letti ng me live my dream.', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 3}),
 Document(page_content='5 \n Introduction  \nMy training site PokerCoaching.com  started off as an experiment to see if I could \nfind a better way to teach my students how to develop the fundamental skills \nrequired to s ucceed at poker. While watching training videos of world -class \nplayers play in real time is great, I thought the lack of interactivity was a problem. \nI decided to develop  interactive quizzes so my students could compare their skills \nto mine in real time , get ting immediate feedback on spots where I disagree with \ntheir strategies . After putting in just a bit of time working on their games, my \nstudents  started seeing  improvements, and eventually, significant , life -changing  \nwins.  \nJonathan Little’s  Poker WorkBook : Volume 1  is a brief sampling of what you can \nexpect at PokerCoaching.com. The only difference is PokerCoaching.com’s quizzes \nare in a video format whereas these are in written form. This book  presents 15 \nhands, five from  me (Jonathan Little), five from  Matt Affleck, and five from  Alex \nFitzgerald.  While our strategies may differ from time to time, we are all long -term \nprofessional poker players who have stood the test of time . By studying our \nstrategies and comparing your skills to ours, you will be able t o see the holes in \nyour game and can then work to plug your leaks .  \nIn each quiz, there will be questions with corresponding answers ranked from 0 to \n10 points. While these scores are arbitrary, they are meant to give you an \nunderstanding of how we think e ach answer fares in relation to the others . \nSometimes, a few answers will be close and other times, there is a clearly correct \nanswer. If you find that you are often choosing the right answer , or an answer \nthat gets a high score , you are playing well. If y ou seem to choose answers that \nreceive 0 points almost every time, you have lots of work to do!  \nI hope you enjoy progressing through this book as much as I enjoyed putting it \ntogether. While this is only Volume 1 of the series, the plan is to have many mor e \nvolumes so you can continue improving your skills using this printed format. In the \nhigh stakes games , at this point in time , most players limp  with their entire \nplayable range from the small blind  when everyone fo lds to them . Keeping that in \nmind, against an extremely wide range, you should raise your best hands for \nvalue. While A -9 is far from premium, it can extract significant value from the \nopponent’s worse A -x hands as well as various hands containing two some what \ncoordinated cards. If for some reason you thought your  opponent planned to limp \nwith the intention of reraising, you should  be more inclined to check to ensure \nyou get to see the flop. Notice if you min-raise, he will call essentially every time, and he won’t be \nmaking much of a mistake , due to his excellent pot odds.  Document(page_content='21 \n Score:  \n4. \nFold (9 Points)  \nCall (2 Points)  \nRaise to 5,000,000 (10 Points)  \nGo all -in (9 Points)  \n \nThis is an interesting spot because , in reality, you sh ould likely continue betting \nthe turn with Q -9 and 9 -7, but there is no way for your opponent to know that  is \nthe strategy you are likely to employ . You sh ould, however, definitively check \nbehind with T -T, which improved to a set. When figuring out which hands to  bluff \non the river, you should strive to have a 9 in your hand because having a 9 ma kes \nit much less likely your opponent has the straight. While your overall river range \nshould rarely raise because most of it will be either marginal made hand s or junk, \nyou should raise as a bluff from time to time , because there are also a few \npremium hands you want to raise  for value . Since most of your  hands that have a \n9 also have a pair, it is fine to bluff with  all your unpaired 9s, although that may \nnot be the case if you use an overly aggressive preflop strategy that includes \nraising all combinations of 9-5, 9-3, and 9 -2. It is difficult to know which raise si ze \nis best, but in general, most players will call a raise with the same range when \nfaced with an all -in or almost an all -in, often making the smaller size ideal when \nbluffing (just don’t let your opponents know your strategy!).   \nYou raised to 5,000,000. Your opponent folded Kc -7c, which he was also bluffing \nwith.  It is impossible to know whether or not he would have folded a made hand , \nmaking it difficult to know if your bluff was great or hopelessly optimistic .', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 20}),
 Document(page_content='22 \n Tricky Preflop Spot  \nWith blinds at 125,000/250,000 with a 30,000 ante, a good, loose aggressive \nplayer raises to 550,000 out of his 8,500,000 stack from the lojack  (also first \nposition in this situation) .  Document(page_content='23 \n Score  \n1. \nFold (8 Points)  \nCall (6 Points)  \nReraise to 1,200,000 (7 Points)  \nReraise to 1,500,000 (10 Points)  \n \nWhile calling may seem like a good idea , because in general , you don’t want to \nplay a large pot with A -J against what is likely a strong early position raise, since \nall your opponents play well, it is too likely that someone yet to act will reraise, \nforcing you to fold. Also, the initial raiser could easily have yo u dominated, which \nis not where you want to be. So, folding is a perfectly viable option. Reraising is \nalso a decent option. While it  will often result in the initial raiser going all -in, it will \nput him in a tough  spot with the weaker part of his range , such as 7 -7, A-J, K-Q, \nand 9 -8s. That said, if he is simply going to go all -in with his entire preflop raising \nrange, either calling or folding is a much better strategy  because you will usually \nnot be getting the correct pot odds to justify calling an all -in.', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 22}),
 Document(page_content='24 \n You 3-bet to 1,500,000. Everyone folds around to the preflop raiser, who pushes \nall-in for 8,500,000 total.  \n \nShould you:  \n2. \nFold  \nCall', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 23}),
 Document(page_content='25 \n Score : \n2. \nFold (10 Points)  \nCall (0 Points)  \n \nThe first thing you should consider when deciding whether or not  to call an all -in \nare your pot odds. This time, you have to put in roughly 7,000,000 to win a pot \nthat will be 17,530,000 if you call, meaning you need to win 40% of the time to \nbreak even (7M/17.53M). While calling may be tempting because you beat all \nyour opponent’s bluffs and are flipping against the medium pairs, you must make  \nan easy fold. Against a reasonable range including 9 -9+, A -Js+, A -Qo+, and K -Qs, \nyour A-Jo only has 31% equity. If the opponent is instead pushing 7 -7+, A -Ts+, A -\n5s – A-2s, A -Jo+, K-Js+, and K -Qo, your A-Jo still only has 43% equity, making it \nroughly  break -even. So, unless the opponent is an absolute lunatic, you should \nfold.  \nYou decided to fold. Your opponent had T -T, one of the few hands you were \nflipping against. Even though you should have called if you knew your opponent’s \nexact hand , folding will work out well for you in the long run  because you were in \nbad shape against your opponent’s range.', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 24}),

 Document(page_content='39 \n Score:  \n4. \nCheck (2 Points)  \nBet 3,500,000 (3 Points)  \nBet 8,000,000 (4 Points)  \nGo all -in (10 Points)  \n \nOn the river, the only play that makes sense is to go all -in for about 2/3 of the size \nof the pot. As on the turn, if you check, your opponent will check behind with \nmany of his marginal made hands,  opting to only bet with full houses and flushes, \nwhich will call your 2/3 pot bet. The only hands you may miss value from are \nbusted straight draws, but even then, those hands should strongly consider giving \nup on the river because when you check, you cou ld easily have a decently strong \nhand. While most competent opponents will fold some of their top pairs and \noverpairs, betting is still the right play as it allows you to bluff with some of your \nbusted draws.  \nYou decided to go all -in.  Document(page_content='41 \n Set Up  \nThe following hands were played in a $5/$5/$10 No -Limit Hold’em  cash game \nsession at Bellagio. This game was live streamed on Twitch with hole cards shown \non a 30 -minute delay. The minimum buy -in was $1,000 and the maximum was \n$2,000. You started the session with $2,000. It is important to note that there are \nthree bl inds in this game of $5, $5, and $10, which occasionally changes the \ngeneral strategy a bit compared to a “normal” two -blind game.  \nThe game consists of a few regulars who play all the time as well as a few \nrecreational players who are playing due to the g ame being streamed.', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 40}),
 Document(page_content='42 \n Tough Spot with an Overpair  \nIn your first hand at the table, you are dealt Q -Q under the gun and raise to $40. \nOnly the button, a loose, aggressive, and competent recreational player calls. The \nflop comes 9h -4h-4d. The pot is $100.  \n \nShould you:  \n1. \nCheck  \nBet $30  \nBet $50  \nBet $70  \nBet $100', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 41}),
 Document(page_content='43 \n Score:  \n1. \nCheck (4 Points)  \nBet $30 (2  Points)  \nBet $50 (10 Points)  \nBet $70 (5 Points)  \nBet $100 (1 Point)  \n \nThis is a very uncoordinated flop that you should continuation bet at a high \nfrequency. Due to the low nature of the flop (4s and 9s compared to Jacks and \nAces), it is more likely that both players missed. You will want to continuation bet \nas a bluff with most of your unpaired hands, therefore you should bet with your \nstrong hands as well. If you  were in position, I would prefer a small bet of around \n33% pot because this flop is so uncoordinated and should not significantly \nimprove either player’s range. Since you are out of position, I prefer sizing up a bit \nto 50% pot. This charges his hands lik e A-J more to call and realize their equity. \nDue to the lack of coordination on this board, I dislike the larger bet sizes of 70 \nand 100. It will be hard for the opponent to have a hand that can call a bet that \nlarge.', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 42}),
 Document(page_content='44 \n You bet $50 and the opponent calls.  \nThe turn is the (9h -4h-4d)-2s. The pot is $200.  \n \nShould you:  \n2. \nCheck  \nBet $50  \nBet $100  \nBet $150  \nBet $200', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 43}),
 Document(page_content='45 \n Score:  \n2. \nCheck (6  Points)  \nBet $50 (1 Point)  \nBet $100 (10  Points)  \nBet $150 (5  Points)  \nBet $200 (2  Points)  \n \nThinking about your opponent’s range, it is safe to assume his range is roughly a \n4, 9, Ace -high with two over cards, flush draws, and smaller pocket pairs. In this \nsituation, you are either way ahead or way behind. You do not have a ton of \nhands to bluff with due to the lack of draws. Your best bluffs are flush draws and \nhands with two over cards to the 9. Since you are way ahead or way behind, you \nshould use a smaller bet sizing with a hand that should frequently be ahead of \nyour opponent’s hand. For this reason, I prefer a 50% pot bet of $100. If you bet \nlarger ($150 or $200), there is a chance your opponent mostly calls with hands \nthat beat you. Checking is also an option since you may only get one more street \nof value from your hand. Against curious opp onents though, I always prefer \nbetting to checking.', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 44}),
 Document(page_content='46 \n You bet $150 and your opponent calls. The river is the (9h -4h-4d-2s)-6d. The pot \nis $500.  \n \nShould you:  \n3. \nCheck  \nBet $150  \nBet $250  \nBet $400  \nBet $500', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 45}),
 Document(page_content='47 \n Score:  \n3. \nCheck (5 Points)  \nBet $150 (1 Point)  \nBet $250 (10  Points)  \nBet $400 (8  Points)  \nBet $500 (3  Points)  \n \nThe board ran out quite cleanly for you. None of the obvious draws completed \nand if you had the best hand on the flop, you are still likely to have the best hand. \nGiven the obvious flush draw mi ssed, you should continue betting with your best \nmade hands, including Q -Q. This allows you to bluff with a few of your missed \ndraws in order to possibly fold out hands like weak 9s, 8 -8, and 7 -7. If the river \nwas the 6h instead of the 6d, you should inste ad check Q -Q. \nChoosing the right bet size on the 6d river is tricky. You could choose a large bet \nsize of near full pot that allows you to bet with polarized range of effective nuts or \nnothing. You could alternatively choose a smaller size of 50% pot that allows you \nto bet a wider range of decently s trong, but non -nut hands like T -T and A -9, \nlooking to target the weaker parts of your opponent’s range.  Document(page_content='51 \n Score:  \n1. \nFold  (0 Points)  \nCall (10 Points)   \nReraise to $90 (5  Points)  \nReraise to $120 (3  Points)  \nReraise to $150 (1 Point)  \n \nIn general, you just want to call preflop raises wi th your small pocket pairs.  Document(page_content='53 \n Scores:  \n2. \nCheck (0  Points)  \nBet $50 (2 Points)  \nBet $100 (10  Points)  \nBet $135 (8 Points)  \nBet $200 (6  Points)  \n \nYou definitely want to bet this flop.  Document(page_content='64 \n Bomb Pot  \nThe next hand is uniq ue in that it starts with what is referred to as a “bomb” pot. \nA bomb pot is where every player puts in $50 before the flop and the hand goes \nstraight to the flop. There is no preflop betting, simply a $450 pot going to the \nflop with all players having a c ompletely random hand. Bomb pots are a fun way \nto spice up the game because you get to compete for 45 big blinds in a nine -way \npot, which essentially never happens.  Document(page_content='65 \n You are in the cutoff with Qh -Jh.  \nThe flop comes Ts -9d-4h. The pot is $450.  \nThe action checks around to the hijack, who bets $200.  Document(page_content='66 \n Score:  \n1. \nFold (0  Points)  \nCall (7  Points)  \nRaise to $500 (3 Points)  \nRaise to $700 (10 Points)  \nRaise to $900 (5  Points)  \nRaise to $1,100 (3  Points)  \nGo all -in (0  Points)  \n \nThis is a very interesting spot. Since there was no action preflop, every player sees \nthe flop with 100% of preflop starting hands. That means the bettor can easily \nhave hands like T -9o, T -4o, and 9-4o that would never be played under normal \ncircumstances.  It also means he may be betting marginal made hands such as top \npair or decent medium pairs for protection, all of which would benefit from \nmaking the remaining eight players fold whatever equity they have.  \nIn addition to having the open -ended straight d raw, you also have two strong \novercards and a backdoor flush draw, increasing your equity over a naked open -\nended straight draw. Even against top two -pair, you still have lots of equity.  \nTaking all these factors into account, plus the fact that you would like to raise \nwith your premium made hands such as sets, two -pairs, and overpairs, I think \nraising makes the most sense. A $700 raise risks about the size of the pot and \ngives you a great chance to steal it. Even if your opponent calls, you can push all -\nin on the turn when it brings any heart, King, or 8. If the turn is a Queen or Jack, I \nwould usually check behind. If the flop bettor goes all -in, you will be pot \ncommitted and have to  make the crying call. There is a good chance he may shove \na hand like A -T that you are flipping against.  \nWhen choosing your raise size, you could make it $500, but then, you should \nstrongly consider folding if you get jammed on. If you raise to $900 or m ore, i t \nscreams to your opponent that you are never folding, which is fine with your \nexact hand, but you certainly want your opponent to push all -in when you have a \npremium made hand. Remember to always take your entire raising range into \naccount, not just  your exact hand.', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 65}),

 Document(page_content='74 \n You call.  \nThe turn card is the ( Qs-8d-7s)-Th. The pot is $855. Your opponent checks .  \n \nShould you:  \n4. \nCheck  \nBet $360  \nBet $450  \nBet $625  \nBet $800', metadata={'source': 'players/jonathan_little/little_pdfs/workbook.pdf', 'page': 73}),
 Document(page_content='75 \n Score:  \n4.  \nCheck (0  Points)  \nBet $360 (7 Points)  \nBet $450 (10  Points)  \nBet $625 (5  Points)  \nBet $800 (3  Points)  \n \nWhen you improve to top two -pair on this coordinated turn, you have an easy \nvalue bet. There are very few hands that beat you, meaning you have the \neffective nuts. You also have lots of options for your bet size. When determining \nwhich  size to use, I begin by thinking about which hands I want to bet for value. I \nwould usually bet with all sets, two -pairs, A -A, K-K (if you didn’t 4 -bet them \npreflop) and A -Q. Next, you want to consider your hands that could semi -bluff, \nincluding your flus h draws, such as As -Ts, Ks -Qs, and various hands containing a 9, \nsuch as T -9s and 9 -8s. Since you have lots of value hands that would like to bet, \nyou should also bet with a lot of semi -bluffs . However, you don’t have a ton, so \nuse a medium to small bet si zing, like $450 or $360.  Document(page_content='76 \n You choose the slightly smaller than optimal bet size of $360 and your opponent \ncalls.  \nThe river is the ( Qs-8d-7s-Th)-8s. The pot is $1,575.
